column2: Meetings     Manage and maintain the CEO s schedule for online as well as in-person meetings. Be present in those meetings wherever possible. Taking and sharing meeting notes with stakeholders. Following on actionable items with responsible people and setting up followup meetings.             Travel     Coordinate travel arrangements, including flights, hotels, ground transportation, visa requirements for the CEO and other senior executives as needed. Also coordinate vacation and time-off for the CEO.             Communication     Manage incoming communications, including screening and directing phone calls, emails, slack, social media mentions, and other correspondence for the CEO.             Events     There are monthly townhall events, leadership meetings/retreats, and other special events that the CEO needs to host from time to time. Planning all activities around it including communicating to vendors, budget planning, reimbursements, etc.             Feedback     As you work closely with the CEO and other senior executives, you will have observations and feedback for improvement for the CEO and other senior executives. Please share feedback proactively to avoid failures, rather than using shortcomings later.             Errands     Sometimes you will need to manage a few errands for the CEO to save their time and energy.              Manage Documentation Projects     You shall assist the CEO in making or compiling documents, presentations, and reports. Also keep track of internal projects which are crucial for future success and manage the status of them.           Must Haves                 Minimum 4 years experience as an Executive Assistant to a C-level executive in a sizable organization (100+ people).             At least 2 years experience in an IT industry. Ideally, a consulting agency where you have been exposed to clients. IT industry experience can be in project management, human resource, operations or any other people-centric domains.             Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Hindi. You must have a concise communication style, anticipating followup questions, answering them in advance, making recommendations.             Comfortable with technology required to get things done. Good with Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Slides). You don t need to have coding skills, but you need to be a power user when it comes to using sheets and docs.             You will have access to confidential information, including financial information, the CEO s phone, mailbox, documents. So you must handle confidential information with discretion and maintain confidentiality at all times.              Strong organizational, behavioral and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage competing priorities. Your approach towards work should be proactive, without requiring CEOs to follow up with you.           Good to Have                 Understanding of agency business operation.              Understanding of WordPress in any aspect, be it the software or community.             A personal blog where writing and comprehension skills can be seen.             Verbal communication skills in Marathi.

Purpose and Value Proposition of the Role   Purpose of this particular role   ??????? The aim of the Individual holding this role will be to increase the overall efficiency of a CMD/Director by ensuring timely and efficient execution of the assigned administrative/operational duties and bringing in bandwidth to the matters handled by the CMD/CxO/Director.   ??????? Ensure the effective and efficient time usage for providing band-with to them to deal with strategic matters while ensuring operational and administrative matters are well coordinated, executed.   ??????? column2: Provide strategic assistance in the management of the Country Director daily activities while serving as a point of contact between the Country Director and all internal and external communications.     Manage an active calendar of appointments; completing expense reports; composing and preparing correspondence; arranging complex and detailed travel plans, itineraries and agendas and preparing minutes and other necessary documents for meetings.     Prepare reports, proposals and letters and coordinate oral and written communication with both internal and external stakeholders.     Work with the Country Director to develop effective systems to ensure the smooth operations of the Business.     Organize and coordinate office functions activities and communications to ensure efficient workflow and office operations.     Prioritize and follow up on all incoming issues and concerns addressed to the Country Director including sensitive and confidential issues. Also, determine the appropriate course of action, delegations, or response.     Manage communication between the Country Director and the other staff, demonstrating leadership and maintaining credibility and trust, while supporting other staff.     Work closely and effectively with the Country Director to keep him well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities and following up appropriately.     Provide effective calendar management for the Country Director while working closely with the Team Leads to prioritize inquiries and requests while managing schedule conflicts; making fast decisions and recommendations to ensure smooth daily engagements.     Manage commitments and responsibilities while maintaining contacts with Team Leads and conducting follow up appropriately.     Manage the Country Director s areas of focus in advance of meetings and conferences. Keeping him updated about changes, new issues and anything that might affect his schedule, commitments and responsibilities.     Provide a bridge for smooth and effective communication between the Country Director and team leads, demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust, and support with the Management Team.             Bachelors degree in business administration or any other related discipline.     Minimum of 5 plus years of experience reporting directly to and supporting senior management executives.     Project management, operations management and executive support experience, including supporting C-level executives in a fast-growing industry.     Ability to execute task with a diversity, equity, and inclusive mindset.     Ability to maintain a high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.     Ability to collaborate and delegate duties but also strong organizational, project management and problem-solving skills with impeccable multi-tasking abilities.     Ability to work with diverse groups of people, including senior executives, employees and founders.     Ability to react with appropriate levels of urgency to situations and events that require quick response or turnaround.

column1: Executive Assistant To Chief Executive Officer
column2: Executive Assistant to the CEO   Job Summary: The Executive Assistant to the CEO is a highly skilled and proactive individual who serves as a critical support system for the Chief Executive Officer. This role requires exceptional organizational abilities, strong communication skills, and the capacity to handle a diverse range of responsibilities with a high degree of professionalism and discretion. Key Responsibilities: - Manage the CEO's calendar, schedule, and travel arrangements, ensuring optimal use of the CEO's time and availability. - Coordinate and prepare for the CEO's meetings, conferences, and events, including agenda development, materials compilation, and follow-up. - Serve as the primary point of contact for the CEO, screening and prioritizing incoming communications, and responding on the CEO's behalf when appropriate. - Provide administrative support, such as drafting correspondence, preparing reports, and handling sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality. - Liaise with the executive team, board of directors, and other stakeholders on behalf of the CEO, fostering effective communication and collaboration. - Anticipate the CEO's needs and proactively identify and solve problems to ensure the smooth operation of the office. - Assist with special projects and ad-hoc tasks as assigned by the CEO, demonstrating flexibility and a willingness to take on new challenges. - Maintain a high level of discretion and professionalism when handling sensitive information and dealing with confidential matters. Qualifications and Skills: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a relevant field (e.g., business administration, communications, or a related discipline). - 5+ years of experience as an executive assistant. - Candidate must have a good command of short-hand/ Stenographer and letter drafting. -  Candidate from the EPC( water, Telecom and power projects) industry would be preferred - Exceptional organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask effectively. - Superb written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of the organization. - Proficient in using a variety of software applications, including Microsoft Office suite, calendar management tools, and project management software. - Demonstrated ability to maintain strict confidentiality and exercise sound judgment. - Proactive problem-solving skills and the capacity to work independently with minimal supervision. - Adaptable and flexible, with a willingness to take on new challenges and learn new skills as needed. - Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.   Salary Range: Competitive, based on experience and qualifications.
column11: Executive Assistant, Travel Arrangements, Personal Assistance, Secretarial Activities, Calendar Management

column2: Administrative & Social Media Assistant We are looking for an exceptional Administrative & Social Media Assistant to join our new start-up. This role will initially be work from home only, which we intend to transition to an in-office role, most likely in South Mumbai, in the coming years. The salary offered for this role will depend on experience, skills and performance. Company Overview We operate in a variety of sectors including tech, media, Indic / Bharatiya culture and real estate. We also run not-for-profit projects ranging from education to legal / policy activism.  We are committed to excellence in all we do, and seek people with strong skills and values to join us as we continue to grow. We love and are devoted to our work. We seek people of a similar disposition, who thrive in a culture of taking full responsibility for and ownership of what we do, and doing so with a sense of pride & love. In return, we operate on the basis of trust and devolution of responsibility. This can be a dream environment for some, but not so for others. Position Overview We seek a talented and proactive Administrative & Social Media Assistant who can effortlessly manage a variety of different tasks in our media start up each day. This includes posting content on social media platforms, communicating with internal and external stakeholders, team and external project management and coordination, proof reading of text, preparation of subtitles and captions for videos, watching and reviewing videos for legal checks, reviewing and summarises videos with clear descriptions, general quality control of our content, data analysis and MIS reports, and other varied administrative tasks. The ideal candidate will be skilled and highly efficient at multitasking between a variety of distinct responsibilities, have an excellent command of the English language, a keen eye for detail, discipline and professionalism. This role involves collaborating with various individuals and teams on a constant basis. Responsibilities 1. Core Tasks Prepare, proofread and accurately format content to be posted on various platforms, including YouTube, X, Instagram, Facebook, Telegram, WhatsApp, websites, and other platforms. Quality check all content, video, images or written, before and after it is published. Check all content for legal and community guidelines conformity. Provide video feedback and improvement briefs to editors and other team members based on QC / other checks. Ensure content is published on schedule and meets all quality and strategy requirements. Prepare, proofread and quality check transcripts and subtitles for videos, and / or text in articles / website / social media content. Daily content and news research for topicality and trends, and schedule management. Collaborate with content creators, video editors, and others to ensure the smooth operation of the production team as a whole. Respond to client / public emails, social media messages, comments, and other means of public engagement. Provide periodic analytics and MIS reports on various aspects of team, company and product performance. Social media hashtag and keyword research according to current trends.  General admin support, other forms of team coordination and communication as and when required. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to continuously improve the quality and effectiveness of your work. 2. Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with the management and content production teams to understand project requirements and objectives. Communicate effectively with team members to ensure alignment on project timelines, deliverables, and expectations. Incorporate feedback and make revisions to processes and roles as necessary to achieve constantly improving outcomes. 3. Organisation and Time Management: Manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously while adhering to deadlines and priorities. Maintain an organised file structure and workflow to streamline your workload and processes. Proactively identify potential issues or challenges and propose solutions to ensure smooth project execution. Qualifications Degree or other professional training in administration, project management or other relevant skills. An excellent command of English (and ideally Hindi, too). Skilled and experienced in using social media applications / back end consoles, including YouTube, Facebook Business Manager, WhatsApp, Telegram, X, etc. Skilled and experienced in using contemporary business / creative applications Google Docs, cloud storage, Canva, and other apps and productivity tools.  Strong attention to detail and the ability to maintain quality while working under tight deadlines. Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work well in a team environment. This job description outlines the primary responsibilities and qualifications for this role. Candidates who possess the appropriate writing and administrative skills, and are exceptional at multitasking whilst maintaining attention to detail will excel in this position. If our culture resonates with you and this role above may be of interest, please apply via our web application link at  gvcec.com . You will need to quote *Indic Media Startup & mention that you found out about this opportunity via the "Naukri Advert".  Thank you, and our best wishes in your search regardless of the outcome of your application.

Other Skills       Customer focus, Communication & Presentation, Time Management, Co-ordination, analytically strong mind, Excellent technical understanding, logical and tactical thinking skills, Dedicated & responsible team player.             ?         Role & Responsibilities:           As Spare Parts Item Administrator you play a key role within Vanderlande s service business. As a SP Item Administrator, you initiate the process and enable the organization to sell spare parts. You make sure the business is supported by proactively inquiring and managing commercial & logistical information of spare parts from suppliers.     Your strong analytical skills, and ability to set priorities and take decisions are crucial for achieving your goals. You will work closely with suppliers worldwide.             Furthermore, you excel at:         Accuracy in your work and systematic thinking in routine tasks and data quality improvements.     Improving processes and tooling from conceptual design to detailed execution     Your interpersonal and communication skills, you are able to build relationships based on trust, persuasiveness and impact.     Teamwork, aiming for quality, but with respect for local cultures. You ensure that your colleagues can depend on a steady, high-quality data management process, by taking initiative and keeping the overview.     Decision taking in order to assure process flow.                           About the Company:          Vanderlande                 Website:        www.vanderlande.com             Vanderlande is a market-leading, global partner for future-proof logistic process automation in the warehousing, airports and parcel sectors. Its extensive portfolio of integrated solutions - innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services - results in the realization of fast, reliable and efficient automation technology.             Established in 1949, Vanderlande has more than 9,000 employees, all committed to moving its Customers businesses forward at diverse locations on every continent. It has established a global reputation over the past seven decades as a highly reliable partner for future-proof logistic process automation.             Vanderlande was acquired in 2017 by Toyota Industries Corporation, which will help it to continue its sustainable profitable growth. The two companies have a strong strategic match, and the synergies include cross-selling, product innovations, and research and development.               Why should you join Vanderlande India Global Capability Center (GCC)                 We are certified as Great Place to Work by the prestigious Great Place to Work Institute.         Flexible and Hybrid Workplace.         Vanderlande Academy and training facilities to boost your skills.         Mediclaim benefit including parental coverage.         On-site company health centers with a gym, employee wellbeing sessions, in house doctor support.         A variety in Vanderlande Network communities and initiatives.         Opportunity to collaborate globally.                 Being you @Vanderlande (Diversity statement)               Vanderlande is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regards to race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

column2: Job Description  Administration Manager Team Management:  They are responsible for managing the administrative staff. This includes hiring, training, and supervising outsourced employees. They assign tasks, set goals, and provide guidance. This helps in the smooth functioning of the administrative team. He is responsible for their adequate availability and record of attendance and Coordination with vendor for the same.   Office Operations:  Admin managers oversee the day-to-day operations of the office. They carry out administrative tasks efficiently. Such as managing office supplies, coordinating maintenance, and implementing procedures. This improves workflow. Ensuring the office is stocked with necessary supplies and that all equipment is working and properly maintained.   Budget Management:  The administration manager job description includes budget planning and management. The administrative budget is fixed. They also control expenses and find cost-saving opportunities.   Record Keeping:  Admin managers keep accurate records and documentation. This includes organizing and archiving files. They manage databases and comply with data protection regulations. Manage office supplies and equipment, including ordering and restocking. Develop and carry out an efficient documentation and filing system. Produce reports, presentations and briefs.   Policies and Procedures:  Their job role includes enforcing administrative policies. It promotes efficiency, standardization, and compliance. They must follow regulations and best practices.   Communication:  They are a liaison between various departments.    Project Coordination:  Admin managers coordinate special projects or initiatives. This includes planning project activities. They assign tasks to their team members. The job requires them to monitor progress and ensure timely completion.   Vendor Management:  The administration manager job description requires overseeing relationships with external vendors. They negotiate contracts and vendor performance. This ensures that goods or services are delivered as per the agreed terms.   Risk Management:  Admin managers find potential risks related to administrative operations. They assess vulnerabilities and implement security measures. They also develop contingency plans to minimize disruptions.   Compliance:  Administration manager roles and responsibilities include complying with relevant laws. It involves staying updated and conducting internal audits. They coordinate with government and legal bodies.   Staff Development:  They support the professional growth of the administrative team. This includes providing training opportunities and creating a positive work environment.   Problem-solving:  Admin managers address administrative challenges and resolve conflicts. Admins find creative solutions to complex issues.   Financial Management:  Administrators can manage budgets, track expenses, and process invoices. We may also work with the finance department to ensure financial compliance. Administration Manager Requirements    At least 5 years of proven experience as administration manager  In-depth understanding of office management procedures and departmental and legal policies  Familiarity with financial and facilities management principles  Proficient in MS Office  An analytical mind with problem-solving skills  Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities  A team player with leadership skills  BSc/BA in business administration or relative field

Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.      Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems. The group enjoys huge reserves of goodwill hat has led to some of the biggest names in the corporate world putting their trust in it and constantly strives to provide products and services that enhance the quality of life and work ,  and to address a gamut of human needs.           Department  /  Position Vacant   Commercial / Facility Executive (Soft Services)    Job Summary:    A Commercial Executive position requires a hard - working ,  dedicated ,  and enthusiastic individual to oversee the operations of the daily activities and processes of the facilities. This is a fast - paced environment that requires exceptional interpersonal skills ,  as well as someone who is able to maintain composure in stressful situations.As a commercial executive ,  you will be required to oversee and coach all employees regarding conduct ,  professionalism ,  job requirements ,  and scheduling.  Building Head / Estate Manager This is a full time position.   Required Experience and Skill Set:    Prior operational experience of at least 4 - 5 years in facility industry is mandatory.   High school Diploma preferred. Degree in Hospitality management desired.    Physical Requirements:    Should be physically fit and mentally robust. column2: Role & responsibilities   Responsibilities: Provide comprehensive administrative support to executives, including managing calendars, scheduling meetings, and coordinating travel arrangements. Screen and prioritize incoming communications, including emails, phone calls, and correspondence, and respond or escalate as appropriate. Prepare and edit documents, presentations, and reports for executive review, ensuring accuracy and professionalism. Act as a liaison between executives and internal departments, external partners, and clients, facilitating communication and information flow. Organize and coordinate meetings, conferences, and events, including preparing agendas, managing logistics, and recording minutes when necessary. Maintain executive files, records, and databases, ensuring confidentiality and accuracy of information. Conduct research and compile data as requested by executives to support decision-making and strategic initiatives. Assist with special projects and initiatives as assigned by executives, providing administrative and logistical support as needed. Manage expense reports, invoices, and other financial documents, ensuring timely processing and reconciliation. Anticipate and address the needs of executives proactively, identifying opportunities to streamline processes and improve efficiency. Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion and professionalism at all times. Perform other duties as assigned to support the overall objectives of the executive office and organization. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field preferred. Proven experience as an executive assistant or similar role, preferably supporting senior executives or management. Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact effectively with internal and external stakeholders. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software applications. Ability to maintain confidentiality and exercise discretion when handling sensitive information. Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and make sound decisions. Professional demeanor with a positive attitude and customer service orientation. Perks and benefits   As per Industry Standard

column2: Roles & Responsibilities: 50% EA and 50% will be complete Travel Management & Administration  Reporting directly to the CFO, the Executive Assistant provides executive support in a one-on-one working relationship. The Executive Assistant serves as the primary point of contact for internal and external constituencies on all matters pertaining to CFO. The Executive Assistant also serves as a liaison to the senior members; organizes and coordinates executive outreach and external relations efforts; and oversees special projects. The ideal individual will have the ability to exercise good judgment in a variety of situations, with strong written and verbal communication, administrative, and organizational skills, and the ability to maintain a realistic balance among multiple priorities. The Executive Assistant will have the ability to work independently on projects, from conception to completion, and must be able to work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of activities and confidential matters with discretion. Completes      a broad variety of administrative tasks for the CFO including: managing an      extremely active calendar of appointments. Plans,      coordinates and ensures the CFOs schedule is followed and respected.      Provides "gatekeeper" and "gateway" role, creating      win-win situations for direct access to the CFOs time. Communicates      directly, and on behalf of the CFO. Researches,      prioritizes, and follows up on incoming issues and concerns addressed,      including those of a sensitive or confidential nature. Determines      appropriate course of action, referral, or response. Provides      a bridge for smooth communication between the CFO and internal      departments; demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust and      support with senior management staff. Works      closely and effectively with the CFO to keep him/her well informed of      upcoming commitments and responsibilities, following up appropriately.      Acts as a "barometer," having a sense for the issues taking      place in the environment and keeping him updated. Successfully      completes critical aspects of deliverables with a hands-on approach,      including drafting acknowledgement letters, personal correspondence, and      other tasks that facilitate the CFOs ability to effectively lead the      company. Prioritizes      conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively, and      follows-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline      pressures. Handling senior management and delegates, Hospitality, Secretarial, Administrative Operations, Office Management, Inventory, Logistics, Events, Conference and Seminars, Office supplies and equipment, Calendar, Travel, Visa processing, crises handling etc Solicit and review meeting requests to prioritize appointments. Regularly review scheduled meetings, re-evaluate priorities, and modify previously scheduled appointments. Attend all meetings and take meeting notes and update the discussion sheet in timely manner so that team can work on them. To ensure that all stake holders join the meeting on time and the agenda of the meeting is circulated with the team members in advance. Program managed several projects for product department. Assist the CFO in different functional, as per the requirements and guidelines. Collect the information, record keeping analysis and preparation of different reports and presentation as and whenever enquired. Arrange travel and accommodation for CFO and Managerial Team, Guest House administration, Housekeeping Sanitation, Asset Management for CFO Qualifications   Bachelor's      degree or above Sound      have business judgment, including the ability to handle sensitive and      highly confidential information Ability      to deal effectively with individuals at all levels Professional      temperament, including the ability to remain calm under difficult      circumstances Proven      time management skills, with an ability to effectively establish and      execute priorities in a dynamic and changing environment Proficient      in Microsoft Office (G-suite, Word, Excel, and Power Point), Adobe      Acrobat, and Social Media web platforms. Data      analytics/Data Management/PPT/Advance Excel knowledge is mandatory

column2: Senior Associate - Chennai Experience: 3-6 years What Youll Do:  As a Facility supervisor, you will be responsible for overseeing the efficient and effective operation of all aspects of a facility, ensuring it meets the needs of the organization and its occupants. This role involves managing various facility-related services, including maintenance, security, safety, space planning, vendor management, and budgeting. Your primary goal will be to create and maintain a safe, comfortable, and functional environment for employees, clients, and visitors. Facility Operations Management: Develop and implement facility policies, procedures, and guidelines. Oversee day-to-day operations, including maintenance, janitorial services, and building systems. Conduct regular inspections to ensure compliance with safety and quality standards. Address and resolve facility-related issues promptly and effectively. Vendor Management: Identify and contract with external vendors for facility-related services. Negotiate contracts and service level agreements to ensure cost-effectiveness and quality services. Monitor vendor performance and ensure adherence to contract terms. Safety and Security: Implement and enforce safety protocols and procedures. Oversee security measures, including access control and surveillance systems. Conduct emergency drills and ensure readiness for emergencies. Budgeting and Financial Management: Prepare and manage the facility budget, ensuring cost control and allocation. Track expenses, analyze financial reports, and identify areas for improvement. Environmental Sustainability: Develop and implement eco-friendly initiatives to promote environmental sustainability. Explore energy-efficient solutions to reduce the facility's carbon footprint. Compliance and Regulations: Stay up-to-date with relevant regulations and ensure compliance with building codes, safety standards, and local ordinances. Travel Management: Coordinate all aspects of employee travel, including booking flights, hotels, transportation, and other accommodations. Serve as the main point of contact for all travel-related inquiries and assistance for employees. Maintain accurate records of travel expenses, budgets, and itineraries, and provide regular reports to management. Stay up to date on travel industry trends, regulations, and best practices to ensure compliance with company policies and industry standards. Communication and Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with various stakeholders, including department heads, executives, and external partners, to understand and address their facility needs. Communicate facility updates and changes to all relevant parties. Who You??l Need to Be: Bachelor's degree in Facilities Management, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience in facility management, preferably in a supervisory or managerial role. Strong knowledge of building systems and facility operations. Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills. Effective communication and interpersonal abilities. Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Familiarity with relevant regulations and building codes. Knowledge of environmental sustainability practices is a plus.

column2: About Goa Institute of Management (GIM):  The Goa Institute of Management (GIM), established in 1993, is one among the top few business schools of India. The institute is looking for bright persons with interest in education. GIM currently offers 5 PGDM programs: - the PGDM core program; PGDM Health Care Management program; PGDM Big Data Analytics program; PGDM in Management - Banking, Insurance & Financial Services; weekend part-time hybrid PGDM program for working executives. Job Summary:  GIM seeks to appoint a highly organized and proactive Executive to support the Dean (Academics) in managing administrative tasks and facilitating efficient operations within the academic department. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring seamless communication, scheduling, and coordination, contributing to the overall effectiveness of the Dean's office. Primary Responsibilities: 1. Calendar Management: Coordinate and manage the Dean's schedule, including meetings, appointments, and events. Prioritize and schedule appointments based on the Dean's priorities and commitments. 2. Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external communications addressed to the Dean. Draft, review, and edit correspondence, reports, and other documents on behalf of the Dean. 3. Meeting Coordination: Arrange and prepare materials for meetings, ensuring the Dean is well-informed and prepared. Coordinate logistics for meetings, conferences, and events attended by the Dean. 4. Travel Arrangements: Organize travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodation, and creating detailed itineraries for the Dean's travel. 5. Administrative Support: Own and lead administrative support in key tasks related to the functioning of the Deans Office. Perform general administrative tasks, such as filing, photocopying, and handling incoming correspondence. Manage and maintain confidential information with discretion. 6. Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments and administrative staff to facilitate effective communication and cooperation. Act as a liaison between the Dean and various stakeholders. 7. Project Management & Research Support: Assist in the planning and execution of special projects and initiatives led by the Dean.   Qualifications: Master's degree, preferably in Business Administration, Communications, or a related field. Proven experience as an executive assistant or similar role. Strong organizational and multitasking skills with the ability to prioritize tasks. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Word and Excel) and other relevant software. Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information. Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Preferred Qualifications: Previous experience in an academic environment. Familiarity with academic terminology and processes. Knowledge of project management and data visualization tools and software. Applicants interested are required to visit our web page: https://gim.ac.in/careers thereby send in the job application. Applications received in the GIM format will only be accepted. A link of the GIM application format is mentioned on the career page  Link to Apply: https://gim.ac.in/careers The last date of application is 24th May, 2024 Mandatory documents to be uploaded are An updated detailed curriculum vitae (in the GIM format only) Shortlisted candidate(s) will be called for personal interview.  Incomplete applications will not be processed and rejected by the system automatically and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the hiring process.

column2: The Key Result Areas (KRAs) of an Executive Assistant (EA) typically revolve around providing high-level administrative support to executives or senior management within an organization. Here are some common KRAs for an EA: 1. Calendar and Schedule Management Efficiently managing the executive's calendar, scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements. 2. Communication and Correspondence:Handling emails, calls, and other communications on behalf of the executive, drafting correspondence, and ensuring timely responses. 3.Information Management: Organizing and maintaining files, documents, and records, both physical and digital, in a structured and accessible manner. 4. Meeting Coordination: Facilitating meetings, preparing agendas, taking minutes, and following up on action items to ensure deadlines are met. 5. Project Support:Assisting with project coordination, tracking progress, and providing administrative support for key initiatives or special projects. 6. Executive Support: Providing general administrative support to the executive, including preparing reports, presentations, and other documents as needed. 7. Confidentiality and Discretion:Handling sensitive information with utmost confidentiality and discretion, maintaining trust and integrity in all interactions. 8. Relationship Management:Building and maintaining positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including clients, partners, and team members. 9. Problem-Solving and Decision Making: Anticipating and addressing challenges proactively, making informed decisions, and seeking guidance when needed. 10. Continuous Improvement:Identifying opportunities for process improvement, implementing efficient workflows, and staying updated on industry trends and best practices. It's essential for EAs to be adaptable, resourceful, and capable of handling multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.  Roles and Responsibilities     Female Candidates required. Assisting and managing Director's all work. Accompany him to meetings and travel.  Manage A Wide Range of Administrative Support. Provide Administrative/Secretarial Support. Taking notes, preparing reports and drafting mails for the Management. Take or confirm the appointments for the Management. Coordinating for all the internal/external processes & operations. Manage and prioritize phone calls and e-mails of the Management. Maintain a record of all the details of forthcoming events & the events covered by the Management in the recent past. Remind the Management of all the events and meetings as per the calendar dates Manage relationships with vendors and service providers, ensuring that all items are invoiced and paid on time Prepare Accurate & Timely Reports by Collecting Information.  Strong Computer Skills. Open to Travel as and when required. Accompany the directors to key meetings/conferences/workshops if required.
column11: EA, Administration, Personal Assistance, Secretarial Activities

column2: We are looking for a skilled Executive Secretary to join our team. As an Executive Secretary, you will be responsible for handling various secretarial duties along with a basic understanding of accounting and human resources functions. Responsibilities: Manage and coordinate executive schedules, appointments, and travel arrangements. Handle all incoming and outgoing communications on behalf of executives. Prepare and organize meetings, including agendas, minutes, and follow-ups. Maintain filing systems, both electronic and physical, ensuring accuracy and efficiency. Assist in basic accounting tasks such as invoice processing, expense tracking, and budget management. Support human resources functions such as recruitment, onboarding, and employee record maintenance. Conduct research, compile data, and prepare reports or presentations as required. Maintain confidentiality and professionalism in all interactions.   Requirements: Proven experience as an Executive Secretary or similar role. Strong organizational and multitasking skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Proficient in MS Office Suite and other relevant software. Basic knowledge of accounting principles and HR processes. Attention to detail and accuracy in work. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information.
column11: Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities., Proficient in MS Office Suite and other relevant software., Basic knowledge of accounting principles and HR processes., Written Communication, Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

column2: Job Overview: The Executive Assistant provides high-level administrative support to the executive(s) they are assigned to, assisting in the smooth functioning of the executive's office and ensuring effective coordination and communication within the organization. The role involves handling confidential information, managing schedules, coordinating meetings, and facilitating communication with internal and external stakeholders. Key Responsibilities: 1) Calendar Management: a. Schedule and manage appointments, meetings, and events for the executive(s), considering their priorities and commitments. b. Arrange travel and accommodation, and prepare necessary documents for trips. 2) Communication and Correspondence: a. Screen and manage incoming communications, including emails, phone calls, and letters. b. Draft, edit, and proofread correspondence and reports on behalf of the executive(s). c. Coordinate communications between the executive(s) and internal/external stakeholders. 3) Meeting Coordination: a. Coordinate and schedule internal and external meetings, ensuring all necessary materials and information are prepared in advance. b. Attend and document meetings, taking minutes, and follow up on action items. 4) Information Management: a. Organize and maintain files, records, and other documents related to the executive's office. b. Ensure efficient document retrieval and manage confidentiality of sensitive information. 5) Office Management: a. Manage office supplies, equipment, and facilities to ensure a well-functioning work environment. b. Assist in coordinating special projects and events as needed. 6) Travel and Expenses: a. Handle travel arrangements, itineraries, and expense reporting for the executive(s). b. Reconcile and manage expense reports in compliance with organizational policies. 7) Relationship Management: a. Build and maintain positive relationships with key stakeholders, both internally and externally. b. Act as a liaison between the executive(s) and other team members or external contacts. 8) Prioritization and Time Management: a. Assist the executive(s) in prioritizing tasks and managing their time effectively.Role & responsibilities
column11: managing schedules, phone calls, coordinating meetings, records, and letters. b. Draft, taking minutes

column2: We are seeking a highly organized and responsible Administrative Executive to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to manage a variety of tasks and responsibilities that facilitate the smooth running of the office. You will be handling both front and back office operations, general administrative duties, travel arrangements, vendor generation, purchase order creation, and rate negotiation. Your goal will be to ensure our companys administrative activities run smoothly and efficiently. Role & responsibilities   Front and Back Office Management:  Oversee all front and back office operations to ensure a smooth workflow. This includes managing office supplies, maintaining office equipment, coordinating with cleaning staff, and ensuring a well-organized and tidy office environment. General Administrative Work:  Carry out general administrative tasks such as filing, typing, copying, binding, scanning, etc. You will also be responsible for distributing mail, answering phone calls, and maintaining the office calendar. Travel Arrangements:  Plan, coordinate, and manage travel arrangements for staff as needed. This includes researching and booking flights, accommodations, and arranging transport, while considering budget and preferences. Vendor Generation:  Identify potential vendors for various office needs, generate new vendors, and maintain good relationships with them. You will also be responsible for negotiating contracts and ensuring the most cost-effective orders. Purchase Order Management:  Prepare, manage, and track purchase orders. Ensure that all orders are tracked from request through delivery and that all deliveries are received in good condition. Rate Negotiation:  Negotiate rates with vendors to ensure cost-effectiveness. Monitor market trends and update internal rate cards regularly. Meeting Coordination:  Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and conferences. This includes setting up meeting rooms, preparing meeting materials, and taking minutes during meetings. Document Management:  Maintain a comprehensive filing system with digital and physical documents. Ensure all important documents are filed and archived properly for easy retrieval. Communication Management:  Act as a point of contact for internal and external clients. Handle queries and provide appropriate solutions. Budget Management:  Assist in budget preparation and expense management activities. Monitor expenses and suggest cost-effective alternatives. Human Resources Support:  Assist the HR department in hiring processes and new employee onboarding. Help organize and manage employee records, manage HR documents (e.g. employment records and onboarding guides) and update internal databases. Office Maintenance:  Coordinate with the maintenance team to ensure office equipment is in good working condition and coordinate repairs when necessary. Reporting:  Prepare regular reports on expenses and office budgets. Maintain and update company databases. Confidentiality:  Handle sensitive information in a confidential manner. Preferred candidate profile   Proven experience as an administrative executive or similar role Proficiency in MS Office and office management software Excellent organizational and time management skills Strong negotiation and vendor management skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks Problem-solving attitude with an eye for detail Bachelor?? degree in Business Administration or related field is preferred

column2: Job Description    a) Develop a fundraising strategy that includes yearly targets to meet the costs of the current and future programmes;    b) Develop annual work plans based on the approved strategy and prepare income and expenditure budgets for each fundraising initiative;    c) Approach and raise funds from individuals, Government departments, Corporate, INGOs and other public trusts within India and internationally.   d) Organize regular fundraising events/ activities in the region.   e) Ensure that fundraising activities are in line with the organization goal and that communication materials are in consistent style that reflect the values of the organization.   f) Conduct research into potential donors - trusts, foundations, companies and high net worth individuals - and prepare proposals and applications for donors whose philanthropic or funding criteria match the organization activities;    g) Build up network with the Central and State Governments and the related agencies and departments;    h) Develop and implement a strategy to revive relations with the existing donors and friends.   i) Develop, manage and update databases to record donor contact and preference information;    J) Ensure timely, appropriate and quality communication to all donors;    K) Monitor and evaluate donor communications on a regular basis;    L) Coordinate with the officer resource mobilization in the planning and execution of the fundraising strategy.   Desired Candidate Profile    a) Demonstrated skills in leadership and management and fund raising & sponsorship ;    b) Knowledge of proposal preparation, events management and major donors;    c) Skills in writing funding proposals for a range of donors including governmental and institutional;    d) Ability to manage multiple donor relationships   e) Ability to work independently and use discretion in confidential matters relating to donors.   f) Proven exceptional written and verbal communication skills - Fluency in written, oral and presentation/ communication skills in English.   g) Ability and willingness to travel   h) Sound knowledge of computer applications.

column2: Roles & Responsibilities 1. Respond to all incoming and outgoing communications, emails, and phone calls on behalf of the CXO. 2. Complete entry-level bookkeeping, including recording expenses, organizing receipts, and completing other transaction records. 3. Resolve billing issues with clients and internal team members. 4. Provide account access, usage reports, data analysis, and other ad hoc requests for CXO and other team members. 5. Support quality assurance checks of various internal and client facing reporting. 6. Organize new client contracts, create invoices, and process client payments. 7. Contribute to internal database maintenance, upkeep and data entry. 8. Research, order, & distribute company-wide gifts (2-3 times per year). 9. Organize company events, competitions, and special projects throughout the year. 10. Facilitate company holiday, time off, and schedule variation calendars. 11. MIS reporting by collecting data from all the departments. 12. Calendar Management: Manage the founders' calendars, schedule appointments, meetings, and events, and coordinate logistics as needed. 13. Travel Arrangements: Make travel arrangements for the founders, including booking flights, accommodations, and transportation, and preparing travel itineraries. 14. Communication Coordination: Serve as a central point of contact for internal and external communications directed to the founders, screen and prioritize incoming messages, and draft responses as appropriate. 15. Documentation and Filing: Maintain organized and up-to-date files, records, and documentation related to the founders' activities, ensuring easy access and retrieval of information. 16. Meeting Support: Prepare meeting agendas, materials, and presentations, take minutes during meetings, and follow up on action items to ensure timely completion. 17. Project Assistance: Assist the founders in various projects and initiatives, including research, data analysis, and coordination with internal and external stakeholders. 18. Event Planning: Assist in planning and organizing corporate events, conferences, and other special events involving the founders, from concept to execution. 19. Organize and prioritize the CEO's schedules, appointments, and meetings. 20. Compile and structure documents, reports, and presentations for various meetings and presentations. 21. Maintain secrecy and prudence when handling sensitive information and conversations. 22. General administrative chores include filing, photocopying, and record-keeping. 23. Provide additional support and assistance to the CEO as required. Confidentiality Management: Handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion and confidentiality, maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and integrity. through the application process      Additionally, you will collaborate with internal teams such as underwriting, risk assessment, and customer service to ensure a smooth and efficient lending experience for clients      Your primary goal will be to facilitate the approval and disbursement of loans while maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements and company policies        Key relevant factors      Product Knowledge: Stay updated on various loan products offered by the institution and recommend the most suitable options for clients      Compliance: Ensure compliance with regulatory guidelines and internal policies throughout the loan origination process      Communication: Maintain regular communication with clients to provide updates on their loan applications and address any concerns or queries they may have      Collaboration: Coordinate with internal teams such as underwriting, legal, and customer service to expedite the loan approval process      Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients to encourage repeat business and referrals      Documentation: Prepare and review loan documents to ensure accuracy and column2: iConsultera is seeking candidates as Executive Assistant with a strong international background to provide high-level administrative support to our executive team      The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment      This role requires a proactive and resourceful individual who can anticipate the needs of executives, manage complex calendars, and handle sensitive information with utmost confidentiality              REQUIRED SKILLS:          2 Years of Experience as an Executive Assistant.          Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, International Relations, or a related field.          Proven experience as an Executive Assistant, preferably with international exposure.          Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meeting deadlines.          Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with fluency in English and proficiency in additional languages preferred.          Proficient in using productivity tools, such as Microsoft Office Suite, calendar management software, and online collaboration platforms.          Ability to adapt to different cultures, understand international business etiquette, and work effectively across diverse teams.          Exceptional attention to detail and ability to maintain confidentiality.          JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:          Manage executive calendars, scheduling meetings, conferences, and events across multiple time zones.          Anticipate conflicts and proactively resolve scheduling issues to ensure efficient use of executive time.          Draft and prepare professional correspondence, emails, reports, presentations, and other documents for executive review and distribution.          Manage incoming and outgoing communications, including screening and prioritizing emails, phone calls, and inquiries.          Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion and professionalism, including organizational database and document management systems          Arrange and coordinate internal and external meetings, including logistics, agendas, presentations, and materials.          Prepare meeting minutes, follow-up on action items, and ensure timely completion of deliverables.          Organize and support international conferences, seminars, and business events, including venue selection, vendor management, and participant coordination.          Act as a point of contact and liaison between executives and international stakeholders, including clients, partners, and government officials.          Conduct research and gather information on international markets, industry trends, and cultural practices to support executive decision-making.          Assist with language translation and interpretation as needed during international meetings and interactions.          Undertake special projects and assignments as directed by executives, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability.

column2: The Associate, Administration position will be based in Telangana state office and will be reporting to the State Manager. S/he will perform varied administrative functions, works independently and under general direction. Monitors, track and book account expenditures, maintains official records, and implements administrative policies. Executes and coordinates office operations such as meetings, conferences, workshops, convocations, office moves, and/or special event. S/he Should be able to travel within the state and India, if required.          Roles & Responsibilities:      Day to Day Support of Office Administration:          Ensure full functionality of Room to Read state office functions at all times (e.g. electricity, utilities, internet, plumbing, pest control, postal deliveries, insurance, office set-up attendance register).          Logistic arrangements for any training /workshop/meeting for all program.          Organize all program related travel and/or transportation needs; liaison with travel agents.          Day to day management of office.          Maintenance of Inventory Registers of state office.          Assist State Manger in maintaining office equipment s and all the administrative issues and supports.            Day to Day support in state level procurement    :          To handled entire Procurement at state level (Identifying vendors, their registration, collection of quotation, sending to procurement committee, preparing comparative statement etc, maintaining procurement register).          To ensure quality of material and delivery on time.          Distribution or dispatch of program related material to destinations and regular follow up with vendors for safe delivery of material.          With support of program team make material verification.          Review of documents as per payment process sheet (for payment of procurement bills only).          Preparation of Fund Request (operational).          Communication with CO/SO team related to Admin work.          Updating Stock Register, PR and PO Register regularly, all receipts files of stationary and other material maintain timely manner all receipts should be there.          Sending request for office stationery requirement.          Preparation of MPR, Work Progress and Work Plan for Admin work.          Providing support in annual planning process at SO Level.          Participation in training/workshop/ meeting organized by CO.          Any other task or combination of smaller tasks that will require a significant amount of this positions time.          Should be able to work on Tally software.          Any other duties and responsibilities given by management team of the organization.                  Qualifications:        Required:        Graduate in any Discipline.          A minimum of 3 years of professional experience.          Ability to travel frequently within the states.          Ability to perform multi-task.          Self-motivated, flexible and able to work without close supervision.          Honest and trustworthy.          Strong negotiation skill.            To be successful as a member of the Room to Read team, you will also:        Have a passion for our mission and a strong desire to impact an up-and-coming nonprofit organization.          Be an innovative and creative thinker; you re not afraid to try something new and inspire others to do so.          Have a very high level of personal and professional integrity and trustworthiness.          Have a strong work ethic and require minimal direction.          Work well independently as well as part of a team.          Thrive in a fast-paced and fun environment.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Job Title: Senior Associate - Operations Location:  Kondapur, Hyderabad About Zinnov and Globalization Excellence ( GE ) team: Zinnov is a 22 year old niche consulting house, with over 350 consultants. Zinnov helps enterprises across the technology ecosystem build, buy and sell technology and technology services. It helps companies with digital disruption in business operations to achieve higher throughput, innovation, productivity and cost savings. With our team of experienced professionals, we serve clients across Private Equity, TMT, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Financial Services & Retail industries in US, Europe, Japan & India.  Zinnov has two major practices:  Globalisation Excellence ( GE ) practice: Designs, builds, scales and transforms world class GCCs/ Technology Hubs. GE enables the globalization strategy of tech driven companies and enterprises through driving increased value, leverage of niche and scale talent, delivering innovative products and scaling customer centric teams.   Technology Business Services ( TBS ) practice helps Technology and Technology Services Enterprises with GTM Strategies, value creation and margin improvement topics. Please visit www.zinnov.com and also do visit our Linkedin Page for details about Globalization Excellence team  Link below (25) Zinnov - Globalization Excellence: Overview | LinkedIn Job Description: As a Senior Associate - Operations, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth operation of our client/s administrative functions. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Administrative      Support:  Providing comprehensive administrative      support to various departments and senior management, including calendar      management, travel arrangements, and expense reporting. Office      Management:  Overseeing daily office operations,      including maintaining office supplies, equipment, and facilities, and      coordinating with vendors as necessary. Documentation      and Filing:  Managing documents, records, and files      both electronically and in hard copy format. Ensuring proper organization,      storage, and retrieval of documents. Communication:       Serving as a point of contact for internal and external stakeholders,      answering phones, responding to emails, and redirecting inquiries as      appropriate. Event      Coordination:  Assisting in the planning and execution      of company events, meetings, and conferences, including coordinating      logistics, preparing materials, and providing on-site support. Policy      Compliance:  Ensuring compliance with company      policies and procedures, as well as regulatory requirements, and assisting      in the development and implementation of new policies as needed. Team      Collaboration:  Collaborating effectively with      colleagues across departments to achieve organizational objectives and      foster a positive work environment. Preferred candidate profile   Requirements: Bachelor's      degree in business administration, office management, or a related field. Proven      experience of 6+ years in an administrative role, preferably in a      fast-paced environment. Strong      organizational and multitasking skills, with the ability to prioritize      tasks and meet deadlines. Excellent      communication and interpersonal skills, with a customer service-oriented      approach. Proficiency      in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other      relevant software applications. Attention      to detail and a high level of accuracy in all work. Ability      to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with      discretion. Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and work      demands. Optional Requirements: Knowledge of Technology products (Networking equipment's, Laptops, Printers) Perks and benefits   - 5 days working

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-oriented individual to join our team     The ideal candidate will have exceptional interpersonal skills, a strong background in guest relations management, client management, hotel booking, cab booking, bill processing, and a proactive approach to administrative tasks     This role requires the ability to effectively manage guest inquiries, client relationships, hotel bookings, cab bookings, resolve issues promptly, and ensure a seamless experience for all visitors to our establishment               Responsibilities             Help to establish a world class office by working with internal and external stakeholders lead the transition from the current office to the new location.     Facility Management: Oversee Housekeeping, Security, Repairs and maintenance, pantry, reception etc..     Serve as the primary point of contact for guests, providing a warm welcome and addressing inquiries with professionalism and efficiency.     Maintain a welcoming and hospitable environment for all visitors, ensuring their needs are met and expectations exceeded.     Handle guest complaints and concerns in a timely and empathetic manner, resolving issues to the satisfaction of the guest and the company.     Proactively engage with guests to anticipate their needs and preferences, offering personalized assistance and recommendations.     Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and preferences to enhance their experience.     Coordinate with clients to fulfill special requests and ensure their expectations are met or exceeded.     Communicate effectively with clients to provide updates, gather feedback, and address any concerns or issues promptly.     Manage hotel bookings for guests, ensuring accurate reservations and timely confirmations.     Coordinate with hotels to accommodate special requests and preferences from guests.     Provide recommendations and assistance to guests regarding hotel accommodations and amenities.     Arrange transportation for guests including cab bookings, ensuring punctuality and reliability.     Coordinate with transportation providers to meet guest requirements and preferences.     Assist guests with transportation-related inquiries and provide necessary information about local transportation options.     Responsible for the overall security of the office. Access Control log, Surveillance System CCTV, CCTV footage monitoring in case of any abnormalities; Public Announcement systems, implementation of Everbridge (Mass Communication) systems at Campus responsible for carryout Physical Security Assessment (PSA) for Sites and close action plans.     Surveillance System CCTV, CCTV footage monitoring in case of any abnormalities; Public Announcement systems; PBX deployment with appropriate number of incoming / outgoing lines     Establish systems for checking and maintenance of gate passes for entry and exit of company and materials.     Preparing PR / PO, contracts etc by coordinating with supply chain, receive invoices, review and be responsible all vendor payments.     Responsible for ensuring administration related statutory compliance.     Site administration, such as courier, printing and stationery, ID cards, Annual maintenance contracts etc     Responsible for contractor management, Employee Engagement eg, Get-together, Annual Functions, Welfare Activities, etc     Implement RTX / Collins EHS related facility guidelines in the office.     Implementation of Everbridge (Mass Communication) systems for Campus Responsible for carryout Physical Security Assessment (PSA) for Sites and close action plans     Responsible for implementation of Global Security System (GSS) programs at Campus     Managing Employee Transportation, on time pickup and drop of employees, Hassle free Transport Service by ensuring safety of employees. Periodical Route-survey and Route Optimization, Monitoring of Escort Utilization, Processing of Monthly Bill after through checking; Periodic meeting with Business Unit Heads for feedback regarding Transportation, attending to their grievances, suggestions and feedback.     Budgeting expenditure on administrative activities, analyzing variances and instituting controls in a day-to-day management through continuous improvement tools and technology.     Conducting Accident / Incident Investigation, Reporting and Facilitation of Root Cause Analysis to prevent recurrence and to maintain Zero Accident / Incident Goal.     Submitting weekly / monthly/annual report on Helpdesk operations, transport, visitor management, Contract labour attendance, Food consumption, Housekeeping materials.     Entering and maintaining Annual Maintenance Contracts for critical assets with properly defined SLAs and Maintenance Schedules with deterrent penalty clauses.             Soft Skills Emphasis         Demonstrate exceptional interpersonal skills, including active listening, empathy, and conflict resolution.     Exhibit strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels.     Display a positive attitude and a passion for delivering exceptional customer service.     Possess strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.     Show flexibility and adaptability in responding to changing priorities and demands.               Qualifications           Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to work in teams within deadlines.     Good understanding of Factory / office related regulatory requirements.     Personable with strong communication and relationship building capabilities across all levels of the business.     Practical and logical; able to solve problems quickly, Good leadership skills and excellent stake holder management.     Highly organized with strong administrative skills     Knowledge of local language will be an added advantage.               Experience           Minimum 6-10 years in Office administration               Education Required:           Bachelor s degree in any stream from a recognized university

column2: To provide a high level of professional secretarial and administration support to the India Legal team and, to the extent required, members of the global Legal Department.          To assist in the management of outside counsel payment arrangements in accordance with Legal Department approved practice.         To ensure that clients (internal and external) are dealt with efficiently and politely.             To assist in legal secretarial tasks, including but not limited to:             Supporting the management of the Legal Outside Counsel Billing processes, including supporting budgeting and cost monitoring, maintaining and updating provisions and trackers for legal expenses.         Scheduling meetings, including supporting the preparation of meeting agendas, materials and minutes.          Maintaining calendar of appointments for assigned manager(s) and/or team.          Creating a wide range of documents including contracts, presentations, agreements, reports, proposals, meeting agendas and other documents, using Word, PowerPoint and Excel.         Assisting in compiling Management Information (MI) reports, triage and allocate internal client requests, and tracking actions.         Assisting with the production of papers for internal and external use (printing, photocopying, binding and delivery to clients).         Proof reading and where appropriate commenting on letters and documents.         Dealing with routine legal and non-legal correspondence (telephone, written, email) and referring to other staff as appropriate.         Travel arrangements, including production of detailed itineraries.         Organising and maintaining law libraries, know-how, documents and case files.         Maintaining training and absence records as required.         Supporting ad-hoc special projects of administrative initiatives as required, including supporting departmental requests made by the Legal Chief Administrative Officer ( CAO ).             To be successful in this role, we're seeking the following:              Previous experience in performing senior assistant role with proven competence in supporting broad range of administrative tasks. 8+ years secretarial/administrative experience in Legal or banking industry preferred.         Experience of internal financial and expense management systems and following internal financial and billing processes.         Administrative, secretarial, document production and PA experience, along with advanced knowledge of MS Office packages, especially Word, Power Point and Excel.          Strong prioritization skills, with ability to manage competing requests and switch focus as needed. Ability to evaluate non-standard problems and use judgement to develop appropriate solutions or procedures. Able to identify the level of urgency and escalate as necessary.          The candidate should be seen as approachable , helpful and discreet. Must have a high level of interpersonal skills to handle sensitive and confidential issues.         Advanced organizational skills.         Strong collaboration and communication skills, including ability to appropriately interact with leaders inside the organization.

column2: Job Location: Ambala Cantt (Haryana)  Google Map - https://g.page/r/CeVdJq2byKcLEBM About the Company: Khadi Sadan e-com Venture:  is an established e-commerce company which has PAN India presence, dealing in various niche like clothing, beauty products ect. With four decades of experience, we have evolved into a financially stable organization, committed to excellence and innovation. Company Culture: Our commitment to excellence has been the cornerstone of our success. Khadi Sadan fosters a vibrant company culture centered on empowerment and heritage. Employees thrive in an inclusive environment that values creativity, sustainability, and community engagement, embodying the essence of Khadi's timeless legacy. Joining Khadi Sadan means becoming part of a legacy of excellence, a blend of stability and forward-looking vision. Position Overview: As the  Executive Secretary  /  Personal Assistant , you'll share some of the Managing Director's responsibilities, playing a vital role in supporting business operations. Tracking priorities, managing correspondence, and coordinating tasks to enhance productivity are key facets of this dynamic role. Your primary focus will be to serve as the unwavering pillar of support for our Managing Director as we focus on significant expansion of our business operations . Qualifications and Skills: Diploma or Bachelor's degree. Candidates should be physically fit, agile, and health-conscious. Jovial, friendly, approachable fashion-conscious, and presentable. Modern outlook with global awareness. Proficiency in MS Office and other business applications. Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively. Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. Event management skills would be helpful. Ability to handle personal tasks of the Managing Director like financial investments, philanthropic activities etc. Additional Qualities:  Positive demeanour, highly organized, proactive problem-solver, highly motivated, excellent interpersonal skills, computer-savvy, dynamic, friendly, approachable, flexible, caring, supportive, sociable, and enjoys traveling. Responsibilities: Assist the Managing Director in managing immediate priorities and scheduling activities in business operations. Handle official correspondence and emails on behalf of the Managing Director. Prepare reports, presentations, and business documents. Organize and coordinate meetings, conferences, and events. Coordinate travel arrangements and accommodation. Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information discreetly. Organize and coordinate official events with full ownership. What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. Performance linked incentives. Special allowances to support learning and growth. Opportunities for career growth and development. Dynamic and supportive work environment. Chance to make a meaningful impact on a growing software product company. Contact Information: Feel free to contact us for more information. Call / WhatsApp: 9 4 1 6 3 0 1 0 5 3 Important Information: No Work from Home (WFH) option:  This position thrives on a collaborative in-office environment. Position Equivalence:  Titles may vary based on candidate experience. Preferred Candidate Experience:  Candidates with relevant experience in Business Operations and/or Business Development are preferred. On-the-Job Training:  For exceptional fresher candidates who exhibit potential but lack sufficient experience, we are open to providing on-the-job training. We recognize and value essential qualities, ensuring every team member is equipped for success. Job Types: Full-time, Fresher Pay: 25,000.00 - 50,000.00 per month Benefits: Cell phone reimbursement Commuter assistance Internet reimbursement Paid sick time Paid time off Accommodation will be provided (if needed) Schedule: Day shift Supplemental pay types: Performance bonus Yearly bonus
