column2: Job Title:  Admin Assistant Location:  Naraina, New Delhi  Job Type:  Full-time Company Overview: Continental Device India Pvt. Ltd., (CDIL) is a pioneer and a world class Semiconductor Manufacturer of silicon chips and devices since 1964. With 50 years of semiconductor manufacturing experience, strict standards of quality, constant improvements in R&D, technology, and processes, and the hard work of a team of dedicated professionals, CDIL today is an Indian brand that is recognized globally.  As India is poised for rapid take off and is set to become a manufacturing center for the world, we too look forward to setting new standards of excellence in electronics and introducing our range of products and services to the furthest corners of the globe.  Responsibilities: Assist in general administrative tasks document preparation, data entry, and maintaining records.  Manage correspondence, including emails and phone calls, and redirect inquiries to the appropriate channels, spontaneously. Support the Admin Manager in coordinating day-to-day operations of the department. Assist in monitoring and managing the overall departmental work especially monthly utility bill payments, renewals towards insurance / subscriptions / telephone plans. Communicate with suppliers, vendors, contractors, and service providers as directed by the Seniors and reporting manager.  Assist in scheduling maintenance, repairs, and admin-related tasks. Coordinate logistical aspects of admin-related projects and initiatives. Support the planning and execution of company events, meetings, and gatherings. Coordinate logistics for events, ensuring all necessary arrangements are in place. Assist in maintaining compliance with health and safety regulations within the factory. Support initiatives related to workplace safety and emergency preparedness. Maintain records of vendor agreements, service / AMC contracts, and admin-related documentation. Support the Admin Manager in keeping accurate and up-to-date records. Communicate relevant information to employees regarding admin-related matters. Liaison with relevant government departments.  Assist in identifying and addressing issues and collaborate with the Admin Manager to find solutions to challenges as they arise. Work towards gradually taking on more responsibilities and growing within the role. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience. 1-2 years of relevant experience in an administrative role  Knowledge of Management Information Systems (MIS). Strong communication and interpersonal abilities. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy. Maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality Proficient in Microsoft Excel and other necessary computer skills. Flexibility to take on new tasks and responsibilities as needed. Strong organizational skills for managing files, records, and schedules. Attention to detail for accurate documentation and reporting.

column2: We are an Accounting Company founded in 2012. We provide bookkeeping, tax, and CFO services to eCommerce, Real Estate and Speciality Clinics based in North America, Canada & Australia  We are a 100% remote modern accounting concern.  We are currently seeking an organized and proactive Admin and HR Assistant to support our growing team's needs. Job Responsibilities: Accounting Tasks:  Handle daily accounting responsibilities, including ledger management and expense reporting. Payroll Management:  Oversee the payroll system, ensuring timely and accurate wage payments. Invoicing:  Generate and send out invoices, manage accounts receivable, and assist with financial reporting. Provident Fund (PF) Management:  Administer employee provident fund contributions and ensure compliance with relevant regulations. Bill Payments:  Manage and execute timely bill payments, keeping accurate records for all transactions. Internal Administrative Tasks:  Support various internal administrative duties such as managing office supplies, scheduling meetings, and maintaining records. Compliance and Documentation:  Ensure compliance with corporate and legal requirements, handle TDS reimbursements, and manage FIRC processes with Upwork and Paypal. Required Qualifications: Proven experience in accounting, payroll, or general administrative roles. Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel, and accounting software. Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. A degree in Business Administration, Accounting, or a related field is preferred. Our Recruitment Process Based on the screening of resumes we will shortlist the candidates for the first round. The chances of getting shortlisted will increase if The candidates CV shows stability and does not change jobs frequently Has strong HR, Admin & Accounting skills with a proven record of managing these tasks independently Has knowledge of Compliances. This Shortlisted candidates will be sent mail for the first round, this will be a telephonic interview where we will be asking questions, but not limited to What you know about GATP Solutions Why are you looking for a change Current package & expected  Once the first round is clear there will be a final round with the directors of the company who would interact about your passion, skills, values & why we should hire you. column2: Administrative Associate- College to Career Program   Overview iTeach Schools  is a fast-growing community of transformational schools providing a high-quality and free education to secondary students. We operate nine Grades VIII to X schools across Pune and PCMC, and a unique College to Career program.  (Breeze through our six-year journey   here , or get a peek into a typical school day   here !)   Our students belong to Punes most under-resourced households. We strive to give them a fighting chance at  college, career, and citizenship , through which they can lift themselves and their families out of poverty. We are known for our stellar results, world-class Professional Development, exciting leadership opportunities, and nurturing work culture. Currently, we serve 2000 students and 1350 student alumni through a strong team of nearly 170 staff members. In the academic year 2022-23, we are growing our impact and are looking for exceptional individuals to lead these efforts! Email id and Password Management  Arrange devices for Students.  Data Hygiene Check C-  Document Verification Verifying and giving feedback on students caste or other admissions related documents.  Generating document readiness reports for the students-  verified, stuck or in progress. VizExperts list of clients includes various reputed Government and Defence?           	VizExperts Management Team comprises of some of the best people in the areas of Sales &   Marketing,  Research &   Development as well as Operations.         	VizExperts R&  D Teams are based in Gurgaon and Bangalore and are one of the best in India with graduates from various IITs. column2: The Concur Administrator is accountable for accurate and on-time processing of reports from the Concur Travel & Expense (T&E) system to several ERPs and individuals. They are also responsible for maintaining all aspects of the online system, including but not limited to: user updates, business structure updates, billing information, etc. They will also maintain all processes involved with expense report review and approval ensuring compliance with Company policies. The Concur Administrator will also interact with internal and external stakeholders, and service providers to ensure any integration projects (inbound and outbound) are completed to fruition.             POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:             Concur Expense Tool                     Maintains Concur users in the Concur T&E system by setting up new users, disabling terminated users, establishing usernames and passwords, and other user-specific information required to maintain employees in the system.                             Responsible for all system administration functions including maintaining accurate system limits, branch/cost center relationships, audit rules, tax rates, form creation/update, general ledger relationships as well as all other system administration functions. Role also requires ability to implement expense reporting policy/procedure changes into the Concur system to ensure the system accurately reflects revised company policies.                             Performs expense processor functions including consolidating expense reports in advance of payment by Treasury. This includes checking for errors/policy violations, and verifying and identifying any discrepancies or delinquencies.                             Responsible for interacting with all Concur users including upper levels of management to troubleshoot Concur issues with a range of low to high complexity.                           Additionally, recommend continuous improvement ideas and assist in implementation as required; take personal responsibility for service excellence.                         Perform data analysis based on Cognos Intelligence reporting.                       JOB KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS AND ABILITIES:                       Proficient use of Concur Expense System and Administrator/Configuration menus                         Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills                         Possess advanced skills using Microsoft Excel and Pivot table creation                         Proficient understanding of and hands-on skills working with Expenses and Reporting                         Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize work                           Strong analytical and problem-solving skills                             Ability to work in a fast paced, high transaction environment with strong organizational, attention to detail, and multi-tasking skills                             Ability to work well under pressure and to meet required deadlines                             Solid decision-making skills including ability to analyze impact of decisions before execution                         PROFESSIONAL WORK EXPERIENCE:                       Five years as Administrator of Concur Expense tool.                       EDUCATIONAL AND/OR TRAINING REQUIREMENT:                       Bachelor s degree or equivalent work experience                         Concur Expense Module Certification (preferred)

column2: System administration involves the management and operation of computer systems and networks within an organization      System administrators are responsible for ensuring the smooth operation, security, and maintenance of hardware, software, and network infrastructure      Here are some key responsibilities and tasks of a system administrator:Installation and configuration: System administrators install and configure operating systems, applications, and software on servers, workstations, and other computing devices      System monitoring: They monitor system performance, resource utilization, and network connectivity to identify and resolve issues promptly      This includes monitoring server logs, network traffic, and system health indicators      User management: System administrators create and manage user accounts, permissions, and access levels      They ensure that users have the necessary privileges to perform their tasks while maintaining security and data confidentiality      Security management: System administrators implement and maintain security measures to protect systems and networks from unauthorized access, malware, and other threats      This includes applying security patches, configuring firewalls, and implementing access controls      Backup and recovery: They design and implement backup strategies to ensure data integrity and facilitate disaster recovery      System administrators regularly back up critical data and test the restoration process to ensure data can be recovered in case of system failures or data loss
column11: Resource utilization, Security management, Networking, Operating systems, Disaster recovery, data integrity, User management, System monitoring, System Administrator, System administration

column2: As an Office Administrator, you will oversee various administrative tasks to ensure the efficient operation of our office. Your role involves managing office supplies, maintaining records and databases, coordinating appointments and meetings, and providing support to the team as needed. Responsibilities: Manage Correspondence : Handle phone calls, emails, and other correspondence professionally and efficiently. Visitor Management : Greet visitors, provide necessary information, and direct them to the appropriate person or department. Office Supplies Management : Maintain and organize office supplies, ensuring adequate inventory levels. Record Keeping : Keep records and databases up to date, including employee information, client data, and financial records. Scheduling : Coordinate and schedule appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements. Document Preparation : Prepare and edit documents, presentations, and reports as requested. Financial Administration : Assist with financial tasks, such as invoice processing and expense tracking. General Administrative Support : Support the team with general administrative tasks, including filing, scanning, and photocopying. Compliance : Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures. Confidentiality : Handle sensitive and confidential information with utmost discretion. Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent; a BSc/BA in office administration or relevant field is preferred. Previous experience in an administrative role, preferably in a small business environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Excellent organizational and multitasking skills. Strong written and verbal communication abilities. Detail-oriented and able to maintain accuracy in data entry and record-keeping. Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with team members. Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills. Professional and friendly demeanor. Benefits : Health, dental, and vision insurance. Retirement plan with company match. Paid time off and holidays. Opportunities for skills training and development. Work-life balance with flexible working hours.

column2: We re seeking an Executive Assistant to support our Leaders in their mission to provide top-notch products and services to businesses worldwide. In this role, you ll be responsible for efficiently managing and organizing their schedules and meetings, among other tasks.     Role         Acting as the Primary Point of Contact:    Serve as a central liaison between employees, clients, and external partners.           Efficient Information Management:    Managing information flow is crucial for smooth operations. You will be responsible for handling information in a timely and accurate manner, ensuring that key stakeholders have access to relevant data when needed.           Calendar Management and Meeting Coordination:    Managing executives calendars and scheduling meetings are integral aspects of this role. Your ability to organize schedules and coordinate meetings efficiently will contribute to optimized workflow and productivity.           Travel and Accommodation Arrangements:    Making travel arrangements and accommodations for executives is another essential responsibility. Your attention to detail and proactive approach will ensure smooth travel experiences for our team.           Expense Tracking and Reporting:    Tracking daily expenses and preparing periodic reports are critical for financial management. You will be responsible for accurately recording expenses and generating weekly, monthly, or quarterly reports as needed.           Supervision of Clerical Staff:    As an Executive Assistant, you will oversee the performance of other clerical staff, providing guidance and support to ensure that administrative tasks are completed effectively and efficiently.           Formatting Communication:    Formatting information for internal and external communication is essential for maintaining professionalism and clarity. You will be responsible for creating and formatting memos, emails, presentations, and reports as required.           Meeting Documentation:    Taking minutes during meetings is crucial for documenting decisions, action items, and key discussions. Your attention to detail and note-taking skills will ensure accurate meeting records.           Phone Call Screening and Correspondence Distribution:    Screening and directing phone calls, as well as distributing correspondence, are integral aspects of managing communication flow within the organization.           Office Filing System Organization:    Organizing and maintaining the office filing system is essential for efficient document management. You will be responsible for ensuring that files are organized and easily accessible when needed.       You Are A Good Fit For This Role, If You:       2-5 years of proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or in a similar role, demonstrating your ability to handle diverse responsibilities effectively.         Excellent knowledge of Google Workplace applications, enabling you to leverage technology for enhanced productivity and collaboration.         Outstanding organizational and time management skills, allowing you to manage multiple tasks and priorities efficiently.         Familiarity with typical office gadgets and applications, ensuring your readiness to handle various administrative tasks.         Excellent verbal and written communication skills, enabling you to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.         Discretion and confidentiality, as you will often handle sensitive information requiring utmost confidentiality.         Ability to complete a high volume of tasks and projects with little or no guidance, demonstrating your autonomy and initiative.       In summary, as an Executive Assistant, you will play a critical role in supporting our leaders and ensuring the smooth functioning of our organization. Your exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to multitask will contribute significantly to our success.

column2: ?We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Administrative Assistant to join our team and provide crucial support in managing day-to-day administrative tasks. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with excellent communication skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving. As an Administrative Assistant, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring smooth office operations, enhancing efficiency, and enabling our team to focus on core business activities.     ?       Responsibility:             Perform a wide range of administrative tasks, including managing phone calls, emails, and correspondence.     Coordinate and schedule appointments, meetings, and events, ensuring calendars are up to date.     Prepare and distribute internal and external communications, memos, and reports.     Organize and maintain physical and electronic filing systems, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.     Assist in managing travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodations, and transportation for team members.     Support HR functions, such as maintaining employee records, assisting with onboarding and offboarding processes, and coordinating office celebrations.     Order and maintain office supplies, ensuring availability and proper inventory management.     Assist in preparing and proofreading documents, presentations, and spreadsheets.     Serve as a point of contact for clients, suppliers, and stakeholders, delivering professional and courteous assistance.     Provide administrative support to the executive team, as required.       Requirements:       Proven experience as an Administrative Assistant or in a similar role.     Proficiency in using office software (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite).     Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills. column2: Greeting from Mouser Electronics. About Mouser: Mouser Electronics, a Berkshire Hathaway company, is an award-winning, global authorized semiconductor and electronic component distributor for over 1,100 leading manufacturing brands focused on rapid New Product Introductions from its manufacturing partners for electronic design engineers and buyers. Mouser was started in the year 1964 and is headquartered at Mansfield, Texas. We are around 2500+ employees and have 27 offices located around the globe. With over $2 billion in annual revenue, Mouser is ranked as the seventh largest electronic component distributor in the world. We conduct business in 21 different languages and 34 currencies. Our extensive product offering includes semiconductors, interconnects, passives, and electromechanical components. Mouser has a strong commitment to customer service, thats why weve won awards for our legendary worldwide customer service excellence. Selection, speed and accuracy are the core of Mousers state-of-the-art distribution center, with sophisticated equipment enabling us to process orders 24/7. ?Website: http://www.mouser.com Job Title:  Office Administrator I Location: India(Bangalore) SCOPE The Office Admin provides administrative and support for the India branch and manages front office. ACCOUNTABILITIES: Professional and maintains constructive working relationships. Relates well with diverse population and at all levels. Responsible for the overall office administration incoming and outgoing mails handling/distribution, coordinates purchasing of supplies, Manage management and acts as contact for local vendors. For Mouser Electronics India, i.e. printed materials, filing records, housekeeping vendors, Facility management Answers calls and routes accordingly, always representing the company in a professional manner. Responsible for preparing reports Provides support locally with business travel arrangements, helps to organize meetings and other Administrative duties as assigned. Supports administrative activities as directed by Manager, Trustworthy with information and always maintains the utmost confidentiality. Manages competing demands and works effectively and efficiently with frequent change, delays or unexpected events SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS A proven successful track record in a previously held office administrative role. High level of interpersonal skills. Ability to work with minimum supervision and make sound independent judgements. Strong problem solving and organizational skills. Accurate, reliable, high level of confidentiality. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in local language, professional communication behaviour to internal and external contacts. Proficient working knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications and email. Strong analytical, organizational skills, and attention to detail. REQUIREMENTS Bachelor Degree preferred and around 0 to 4 year experience in an office administration role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Category: IT/IS This is a summary of the primary accountabilities and requirements for this position. The company reserves the right to modify or amend accountabilities and requirements at anytime at its sole discretion based on business needs. Any part of this job description is subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. If you are interested please send your CV to  archana.a@mouser.com Please refer your friends if the criteria matches the same. Regards, Archana A, Talent Acquisition II MOUSER ELECTRONICS a TTI - Berkshire Hathaway Company www.mouser.com

Office Management: - Oversee day-to-day office operations to ensure a smooth working environment. - Manage office supplies and inventory, placing orders as needed. - Coordinate maintenance and repair of office equipment and facilities. - Ensure the office is clean, organized, and well-maintained. 2. Answers questions related to established policies and procedures.? Directs people to the appropriate resource. Coordinates projects/assignments of broader scope, independently seeking appropriate internal and external resources as necessary such as: Assembling and distributing materials; Compiling and/or tracking data; Verifying the accuracy of data collected. Makes decisions within established guidelines regarding planning, organizing, and scheduling of work. Creates and types routine documents (letters/memos/e-mails, presentations, etc.) and revises as necessary; ensures accuracy in grammar and spelling. Manages work in a confidential manner, ensuring information is shared with internal and external individuals in an appropriate manner. Confidential information typically consists of department or employee sensitive information (i.e. employee salaries). We are currently seeking a skilled and motivated Receptionist/Administrative Assistant to join our team at our Gurgaon Sector 59 location. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the front desk operations, providing administrative support, and ensuring smooth functioning of day-to-day activities. Key Responsibilities: 1. Greet and welcome guests in a professional and friendly manner. 2. Manage incoming calls, emails, and correspondence, directing them to the appropriate personnel. 3. column2: Job Title:  Admin Assistant Location:  Naraina, New Delhi  Job Type:  Full-time Company Overview: Continental Device India Pvt. Ltd., (CDIL) is a pioneer and a world class Semiconductor Manufacturer of silicon chips and devices since 1964. With 50 years of semiconductor manufacturing experience, strict standards of quality, constant improvements in R&D, technology, and processes, and the hard work of a team of dedicated professionals, CDIL today is an Indian brand that is recognized globally.  As India is poised for rapid take off and is set to become a manufacturing center for the world, we too look forward to setting new standards of excellence in electronics and introducing our range of products and services to the furthest corners of the globe.  Responsibilities: Assist in general administrative tasks document preparation, data entry, and maintaining records.  Manage correspondence, including emails and phone calls, and redirect inquiries to the appropriate channels, spontaneously. Support the Admin Manager in coordinating day-to-day operations of the department. Assist in monitoring and managing the overall departmental work especially monthly utility bill payments, renewals towards insurance / subscriptions / telephone plans. Communicate with suppliers, vendors, contractors, and service providers as directed by the Seniors and reporting manager.  Assist in scheduling maintenance, repairs, and admin-related tasks. Coordinate logistical aspects of admin-related projects and initiatives. Support the planning and execution of company events, meetings, and gatherings. Coordinate logistics for events, ensuring all necessary arrangements are in place. Assist in maintaining compliance with health and safety regulations within the factory. Support initiatives related to workplace safety and emergency preparedness. Maintain records of vendor agreements, service / AMC contracts, and admin-related documentation. Support the Admin Manager in keeping accurate and up-to-date records. Communicate relevant information to employees regarding admin-related matters. Liaison with relevant government departments.  Assist in identifying and addressing issues and collaborate with the Admin Manager to find solutions to challenges as they arise. Work towards gradually taking on more responsibilities and growing within the role. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience. 1-2 years of relevant experience in an administrative role  Knowledge of Management Information Systems (MIS). Strong communication and interpersonal abilities. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy. Maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality Proficient in Microsoft Excel and other necessary computer skills. Flexibility to take on new tasks and responsibilities as needed. Strong organizational skills for managing files, records, and schedules. Attention to detail for accurate documentation and reporting.

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for Syastem Admin to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.will be responsible for the maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems, servers, and networks. If you have a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for ensuring the stability and efficiency of IT infrastructure, we encourage you to apply for this position.     Responsibilities : System Maintenance : Install, configure, and maintain operating systems and software applications.Perform routine system updates and patches to ensure security and stability.     Server Management : Manage and monitor servers to ensure optimal performance.Troubleshoot and resolve server-related issues.Network Administration : Administer and maintain network infrastructure, including routers, switches, and firewalls.Monitor network performance and troubleshoot connectivity issues.Security Implementation : Implement and maintain security measures to protect systems and data.Conduct regular security audits and apply necessary updates.     Backup and Recovery : Implement and manage data backup and recovery processes.Ensure data integrity and develop disaster recovery plans.User Support : Provide technical support to end-users, addressing hardware and software issues.Collaborate with helpdesk and support teams to resolve user problems.Documentation : Create and maintain documentation for system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.Keep documentation up-to-date with changes and improvements.Collaboration : Collaborate with other IT team members and departments to implement and support IT solutions.Participate in project planning and execution.
column11: Network administration, Helpdesk, System maintenance, Security implementation, Disaster recovery, User support, Project planning, data integrity, Management, Technical support

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for Intune Admin to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.We are looking for a skilled and experienced Intune Administrator to join our IT team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in the administration, configuration, and optimization of Microsoft Intune, ensuring the efficient management of mobile devices, applications, and security policies.      If you have a strong background in mobile device management (MDM), expertise in Intune, and a proactive approach to IT administration, we invite you to apply for this position.Responsibilities : Intune Configuration and Administration : Configure and administer Microsoft Intune to manage mobile devices (iOS, Android, Windows) and ensure compliance with organizational policies.Implement and manage security baselines and policies for mobile devices.Device Enrollment and Provisioning : Manage the enrollment and provisioning of mobile devices using Intune.Implement and optimize device profiles and configurations for different user groups.     Application Management : Administer the deployment and management of applications through Intune.Ensure seamless distribution and updates of business applications on mobile devices.Security Policies and Compliance : Implement and enforce security policies for mobile devices, including encryption, passcode policies, and conditional access.Monitor and ensure compliance with security standards.Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution : Investigate and resolve issues related to device management, application deployment, and security compliance.Provide technical support to end-users for Intune-related matters.     Integration with Other Microsoft 365 Services : Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate Intune with other Microsoft 365 services, such as Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Endpoint Manager.Documentation : Maintain accurate documentation of Intune configurations, policies, and procedures.Create user guides and training materials for end-users.Stay Informed About Updates and Best Practices : Stay current with Intune updates, new features, and best practices.Evaluate and recommend improvements to optimize Intune deployment.
column11: Application management, Active directory, Issue resolution, Deployment, mobile device management, Windows, microsoft, Troubleshooting, Technical support, Android

column2: Diverse Lynx is looking for Salesforce Admin to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.Salesforce Configuration and Customization:Customize and configure Salesforce features, including user profiles, roles, permission sets, workflows, validation rules, and custom objects, to meet business requirements.Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and analytics to provide insights into sales performance and productivity.     Data Management and Maintenance:Administer data quality, perform data cleansing, deduplication, and data migration tasks to maintain accurate and updated records within Salesforce.Implement and manage data security, access controls, and data sharing settings.User Support and Training:Provide day-to-day support to Salesforce users, troubleshoot issues, and assist in resolving technical problems and inquiries.Conduct training sessions and create documentation for Salesforce users to maximize system adoption and efficiency.System Integration and Enhancement:Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and assist in the integration of Salesforce with other applications or systems.     Evaluate and implement AppExchange apps or third-party solutions to extend Salesforce capabilities.Salesforce Maintenance and Optimization:Perform regular system audits, manage updates, patches, and upgrades to ensure optimal performance and alignment with best practices.Monitor system usage, analyze trends, and identify opportunities for system improvements and enhancements.
column11: Administration, Salesforce

column2: About Company  It provides the most complete range of industrial automation equipment including robots, CNCs and motion control systems. FANUC s innovative technologies and proven expertise help manufacturers in the Americas maximize efficiency, reliability and profitability. Markets served include: Aerospace, Agriculture, Assembly, Automation, Automotive, Construction, Education, Energy, Fabricating, Food, General Motion Control, Machine Tool, Material Handling, Material Removal, Medical, Metal Fabrication, Metalforming, Mold & Die and Woodworking.  Qualification: Graduation (Preferably Electrical Engineering) Experience: 10 to 15 years of experience in Facility Management and Administration in manufacturing industry.  Key Accountabilities & Responsibilities  Responsible for the administration functions across all offices  /  locations in India.  Manage the administration functions of the company like travel, transport, Visa, Security, Guesthouses, Housekeeping, Office management etc.  Responsible for the Capital & Expense budget.  Achieve financial objectives by anticipating requirements; submitting information for budget preparation; scheduling expenditures; monitoring costs; analyzing variances.  To initiate and manage the contracts related to Administration function.  Responsible for proper Asset Inventory management and maintenance of all office equipment s including periodic preventive maintenance.  Assist in the identification of Branch locations, negotiation, lease dead executions, fit - outs and Handover of Branch for Business.  Identify and develop strong vendor relationships that are reliable and cost effective.  To manage and support in the In - house shows, Exhibitions and VIP visits.  Responsible for the statutory compliances across all locations.  To ensure availability of trained resources in the department for the function by providing necessary training inputs.  Ensure proper Project estimation and scheduling and adhering to the deadlines.  Skills Required  Proven experience in developing ideas and implementing change and new initiatives  Excellent organizational skills with the ability to deliver to set deadlines  Proven ability in judgment  /  decision making on a variety of issues within tight deadlines.  Strong interpersonal, report writing and statistical analysis skills with the ability to communicate at all levels.  Proven ability in multitasking and prioritizing workload.  Knowledge of regulatory requirements.  Knowledge of Labor laws and related statutory compliances.  Proven experience in developing ideas and implementing change and new initiatives  Proficient in MS Office applications. If interested please send your UPDATED Profile with below mentioned details. column2: The Company   Aquascape Engineers Pvt. Ltd. has an exciting new opportunity within a long- established manufacturing organization using a variety of Machining and Fabrication processes to manufacture their products from our modern purpose- built facility located in Ahmedabad,  GUJARAT   We supply components into Aerospace industry,  and have a vision to develop these and wider markets making the working environment fascinating and challenging.   A requirement has now arisen for an ADMIN cum BACK- OFFICE EXECUTIVE to join the Company.   Job brief   The tasks of the office administrator will include bookkeeping and mentoring office assistants. The ideal candidate will be competent in prioritizing and working with little supervision. They will be self- motivated and trustworthy.   The office administrator ensures smooth running of our companys offices and contributes in driving sustainable growth.   Roles Responsibilities   Assist and support administrative staff in their day to day operations. Manage phone calls and correspondence (e- mail,  letters,  packages   etc.) Keeping a close look at all equipments in the company and taking relevant action if equipment does not work properly or damages. Helping HR in conducting interviews. Training new employees. Assist and coordinate with sales and marketing teams. Support sales staff in handling and documenting customer accounts. Prepare and reconcile customer balances. Correct discrepancies in customer account balances. Assist inventory controlling staff in maintaining inventory records. Assist front office staff in maintaining the office premises clean and  neat. Assist front office in preparing,  scheduling and organizing meetings,   events and appointments. Submit timely reports and prepare presentations/ proposals as  assigned. Perform some normal clerical duties such as faxing,  reviewing,   emailing and editing of some important documents and most  importantly keeping all the records intact.    Skills   Proven experience as an office administrator,  office assistant or  relevant role. Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities. Excellent organizational and leadership skills. Familiarity with office management procedures and basic accounting  principles. Excellent knowledge of MS Office and office management software  (ERP etc.). Qualifications in secretarial studies will be an advantage. Good Verbal and written communication skill especially in English  language.

column2: Eninrac is looking for an office administrator who will be responsible for providing administrative support to the team     The candidate will be required to manage the office facility which includes office housekeeping, electromechanical services, security and safety of the premise, and pantry/cafeteria management     The candidate is also responsible for providing services related to corporate travel which includes managing hotel booking and international/domestic travel, office transport, office-related procurement, events & conferences, etc     The candidate should have exposure to general administration functions     You will be required to interact with a large pool of vendors and should be adept at performing duties falling under facility management and general office operations     You should have a high service orientation towards office members     The candidate is expected to be a strong team player, have a high motivation for the administration role, have good learning ability, and be able to communicate fluently in English both in verbal and written form           Responsibilities        Supports company operations by maintaining office systems and supervising staff.     Maintains office services by organizing office operations and procedures, preparing payroll, controlling correspondence, designing filing systems, reviewing and approving supply requisitions, and assigning and monitoring clerical functions.     Provides historical reference by defining procedures for retention, protection, retrieval, transfer, and disposal of records.     Designs and implements office policies by establishing standards and procedures, measuring results against standards, and making necessary adjustments.     Completes operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees and following up on work results.     Keeps management informed by reviewing and analyzing special reports, summarizing information, and identifying trends     Maintains office staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees.     Maintains office staff job results by coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees, and planning, monitoring, and appraising job results.     Achieves financial objectives by preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions.     .Processing order and maintaining MIS for orders and expenses with attention to detail, processing procurement documentation, inviting quotation, making comparison, making PO and maintaining records for all explicit of administration.     Maintaining vendor database, clearing of bills, timely payment.     Creating and maintaining monthly expense report etc     Monitoring emails and replying with resolutions.     Ensuring all mobile tabs devices are in working condition.           Requirements & Skills       Graduate from any stream.     1 year of work experience in core administration in corporate environment, strong organizational and administrative skills.     Proficient in MS Office software (eg Excel, Word, PowerPoint).     Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities/processes at the same time, and prioritize effectively.     Performs we'll under pressure and meets deadlines effectively.     Resourceful and proven effectiveness working with vendors and suppliers.     Strong customer service orientation and outstanding customer service skills with ability to interact effectively at all levels.     Responsiveness to multiple (often ad hoc) requests and strong sense of urgency.     Possesses high energy, a "can-do" attitude, a willingness to take initiative, and a proactive approach to practice and team support.     Flexibility to work longer hours during peak work periods.     Strong and fluent in written and verbal communication skills respectively - able to clearly and concisely convey key information through a variety of communication channels (voice mail, e-mail, face to face.)

column2: The Document Specialist plays a pivotal role in transforming handwritten Work Observation Cards into structured data, managing document creation, and collaborating with management to develop essential documents. This position requires exceptional attention to detail, proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite applications, particularly Excel, Word, and Visio, and strong communication skills. The successful candidate will demonstrate reliability, adaptability, and a proactive approach to handling tasks efficiently and accurately. Key Responsibilities: Interpret handwritten Work Observation Cards and accurately input data into Excel spreadsheets. Ensure meticulous organization and upload of documents onto SharePoint, maintaining 100% accuracy. Collaborate with management to convert raw data into comprehensive documents including process manuals, workflows, and guidelines using MS Word and Visio. Participate in weekly calls with the QHSE (Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment) global head, providing updates and addressing queries. Demonstrate a high typing speed and self-observant nature to meet deadlines consistently. Utilize technical proficiency and familiarity with software applications to execute tasks effectively. Manage workload efficiently, adapting to changing priorities and pressure situations while maintaining quality standards. Possess advanced knowledge of the Visio App to enhance document creation and visualization. Display patience and intelligence in understanding complex documents and data, ensuring accuracy and clarity. Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and contribute to enhancing documentation procedures. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, Word, and Visio. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and document creation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently. Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to changing requirements. Previous experience in document processing or related roles is preferred. Self-motivated and able to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Perks and benefits   Week Offs: Sat & Sun Medical Insurance Provident Fund Gratuity

column2: The Executive Assistant will provide high-level administrative support to senior executives, ensuring efficient operation and communication within the executive office. This role demands a proactive approach, exceptional organizational skills, and the ability to handle sensitive information with discretion. Key Responsibilities 	Calendar Management: Schedule and manage appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements for executives. 	Communication: Screen and prioritize emails, phone calls, and other correspondence. Draft and proofread communications on behalf of executives. 	Meeting Coordination: Organize and prepare materials for meetings, including agendas, presentations, and reports. Take minutes and follow up on action items. 	Travel Arrangements: Plan and coordinate domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, and itineraries. 	Documentation: Maintain and organize confidential files, records, and documents. Prepare reports and presentations as required. Office Management: Oversee office supplies, equipment maintenance, and vendor relations. Assist with budget tracking and expense reporting. 	Project Assistance: Support special projects and initiatives, providing research, data analysis, and administrative assistance as needed. 	Liaison Role: Act as a point of contact between executives and internal/external stakeholders. Foster positive relationships and facilitate effective communication. 	Problem-Solving: Anticipate needs and resolve administrative issues before they arise. Provide solutions and improvements for office processes. Qualifications 	Education: Bachelors degree in business administration, communications, or a related field preferred. 	Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience as an executive assistant or in a similar administrative role. 	Skills: 	Organizational Skills: Exceptional ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment. 	Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with a keen attention to detail. 	Technical Proficiency: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software. 	Discretion: Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion. 	Problem-Solving: Proactive and resourceful in identifying solutions and improvements. 	Interpersonal Skills: Professional demeanor with the ability to build and maintain positive relationships. Working Conditions 	Environment: Office setting with occasional travel. 	Hours: Full-time position, may require occasional overtime or flexibility based on executive needs. Reports To 	Senior Executive(s) of the organization.

column2: Role Description T This is a full-time on-site role for an Executive Assistant to the Chief Executive Officer. As an Executive Assistant, you will be responsible for providing comprehensive administrative support to the CEO. Your day-to-day tasks will include managing the CEO's diary, handling expense reports, coordinating meetings and appointments, and providing general administrative assistance. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of the CEO's office and supporting their decision-making process. Qualifications Strong experience in executive administrative assistance and executive support Proficient in managing expense reports and diary management Excellent organizational and time management skills Ability to handle confidential information with discretion Proactive and resourceful in problem-solving Strong communication and interpersonal skills Proficient in MS Office and other relevant software Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or a related field

column2: The Commercial Office Specialist is responsible for organizing, authoring, and presenting customer-facing responses including budgetary quotes, requests for information, proposals, market assessments, and contracts. Commercial Office Specialist are a liaison between OSIs Sales Managers, Executive Management, Solutions Engineering, Product Management, and potential customers.                  ?       Your Impact           For your assigned proposal and contract projects, define the approach, maintain ownership and accountability for the schedule, align the business position to corporate objectives, ensure quality deliverables, and manage full authorization and approval of the final customer-facing package.          Work with Solutions Engineering, Sales Management, Product Management, and Executive Management to determine approaches and prepare proposals and contract documents.          Review understand RFPs from both nationwide and worldwide AspenTech customers.          Ensure financial details for each proposal/contract follow AspenTechs needs for Banking, Legal, Security, Development, Business/Commercial Terms and Conditions.          Act as primary point of contact with internal and external customers to provide support, administrative, and organizational services regarding proposals and contracts.         Lead and participate in customer meetings and conference calls pertaining to proposals and contracts.         Prepare and manage customer correspondence and communications.         Provide up-to-date information into sales pipeline and forecasting data - accuracy and aligned with proposal solutions as iterations are negotiated.         Follow and reference historical pricing and market assessments to support internal pricing reviews.          Work with a full range of AspenTech staff to identifying and document commercial and technical risk for each proposal.         Facilitate the corporate authorization and approval process - adherence to corporate guidelines and commercial model.                   What Youll Need           Bachelors Degree in Business, Economics, Finance/Accounting, or related field.          Excellent administrative, organizational, and interpersonal skills.         Excellent oral and written communication skills.         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.         Strong attention to detail.         Strong ability to manage several projects simultaneously.         Experience in an international business environment; ability to work with customers, coworkers, partners in different countries, cultures, time zones, work styles, etc.         Experience with Microsoft Office suite of products.         Experience with Salesforce or similar sales opportunity tracking system.
column11: Product management, Administration, Interpersonal skills, OSI, Analytical, Executive management, Management, MS Office, Forecasting, Salesforce

column2: Role & responsibilities    Records officers are responsible for the creation, storage, retrieval and disposal of all recorded information about an organizations activities. Information can come in many formats, such as digital, photographic, film or paper. This information contributes to what is often called the 'corporate memory' of the organization, without which an organization could not function properly or be held accountable for its actions.  Preferred candidate profile    Create and maintain effective relationships with team members in order to obtain the right information  ??Obtain information from different departments and check it to ensure appropriateness  ??Collate collected information, and categorize it according to set specifications  ??Perform data entry work to ensure that all records are timely punched into the system  ??Check each record to verify completeness and accuracy  ??Oversee the management of electronic and paper information     Identify and use appropriate records management systems and resources  ??Set up and review data and records management systems  ??Oversee the conversion of data from paper to electronic forms  ??Deal with incoming inquiries, and provide appropriate feedback  ??Ensure that all punched in data is adequately protected from internal and external threats  ??Classify data according to indexing methods and protocols  ??Ensure that data and records are easily accessible as and when needed  ??Analyze data recording needs, and provide feedback on required systems and resources  ??Ensure appropriate quality control within records management systems  ??Retrieve data after ensuring that it will be delivered to the right people  ??Resolve issues with records and data transfer processes  ??Track and locate records by maintaining a central data list  ??Oversee data migration activities, ensuring that data integrity is maintained at all costs  ??Create and maintain reports on records management systems, resources, and activities  ??Ensure the transfer of newly recorded or amended data to different departments within the company
column11: Record Keeping, Word Processing, Typing, Document Management System, Report Preparation, Records Management, Computer Operating, Data Entry, Administrative Support, Clerical Work, Filing, Document Control, Document Management

column2: BPM is seeking an Executive Assistant to support its Chief Executive Officer (CEO)     The Executive Assistant will provide high-level administrative support for the CEO to ensure efficiency to accomplish key tasks and initiatives     This individual will be responsible for a wide range of administrative tasks, including management of complex calendar and scheduling requirements, tracking key deliverables, coordinating meeting information, and managing follow-up in a timely manner     This dynamic position requires the ability to anticipate needs, think critically, and offer solutions to problems with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality     The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem solver with meticulous attention to detail and exceptional communication skills           RESPONSIBILITIES:        Provide sophisticated calendar management for the CEO, including scheduling meetings, appointments, speaking engagements, and travel arrangements (domestic and international). Prioritize inquiries and requests while troubleshooting conflicts; make judgements and recommendations to ensure smooth day-to-day engagements. Exercise discretion in committing time and evaluating needs.      Coordinate and manage travel, hotel and transportation arrangements, schedules, and all logistical requirements (domestic and international). Prepare preliminary itineraries for review and post final in Outlook. Provide timely air travel information to accounting for each trip and prepare post-travel expense reports.      Compile expense reports, track and maintain reimbursement of those expenses for the CEO. Receive, review, organize and track expense reports from the CEO.      Provide daily email coverage routing messages appropriately and handling routine inquiries. In concert with the Executive Leadership team ensure appropriate follow-up of requests and inquiries are fulfilled.     Work closely with the CEO to keep advised of time-sensitive and priority issues as well as informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities and following up appropriately.     Complete a broad variety of administrative tasks that facilitate the CEO s ability to effectively lead the organization, including assisting with special projects; assisting with designing and producing complex documents, reports, and presentations; collecting and preparing information and agendas for meetings with colleagues and external parties; composing and preparing correspondence; maintaining contact lists.     Maintain professionalism and strict confidentiality in all matters.     Anticipate CEO s needs in advance of meetings, conferences, etc.     Coordinate Executive meetings and assist with staff meetings and events as needed.     Other additional and/or alternative duties as assigned from time to time, including supporting other departments or Executives as needed.               REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:        Bachelor s degree in a relevant field along with at least (10+) years of related work experience.     10+ years of direct work experience supporting sophisticated and curated Executive Office     Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point), Adobe Acrobat, and Social Media web platforms.     Strong familiarity with project management software, such as Monday.com                PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:        Superior organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail.     Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders, including other C-Level Executives, Partners, Board of Directors, and colleagues across the organization.     Highly resourceful team-player, with the ability to also be extremely effective independently.     Committed to a role that, at times, may require time-sensitive urgency and working outside standard business hours.     Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously; reliable and competent at prioritizing and adjusting timetables based on demand and circumstances.     Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion, superb judgment, and integrity.      Adaptable to various competing demands while demonstrating the highest level of service and response.     Demonstrated ability to achieve high performance goals and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.     Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions.     Highly organized with strong ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.     Strong knowledge of operational systems and structures.      Excellent communication skills with ability to disseminate pertinent information to the right people at the right time.               PHYSICAL DEMANDS WORK ENVIRONMENT:        Sitting/Standing/Walking: 100% of time is spent working at a desk.     Speaking/Hearing: Clear diction and acute hearing are necessary for effective communication with co-workers, customers, and outside agencies, by telephone and on video.     Vision: Ability to effectively use the computer screen and interpret printed materials, memos, and other appropriate paperwork.
column11: Administration, Project management, Social media, Consulting, Genetics, Scheduling, Troubleshooting, Operations, Financial services, Automotive

column2: Job Purpose:          Ensures smooth functioning of activities and processes,  acting as a liaison for one or more C-level Executives (President and or VP) in a fast-paced,  dynamic APJ region.  The Executive Assistant performs a variety of core administrative duties and organizational leadership support functions with authority to respond and or make commitments on behalf of the Executives.  The responsibilities of Office Manager cover the seamless operation of the assigned locations.         Responsibilities:          Create written materials that are organized,  professional and audience appropriate.  This includes all correspondence,  presentations and reports.         Manage travel including meeting scheduling,  preparation of background materials,  and all logistical arrangements including,  but not limited to flights,  ground transportation and itinerary creation.         Manage board and or other senior executive; meeting logistics including development of an agenda,  internal and external communications,  coordinate presentation materials,  travel arrangements,  expense spend and preparation and recording of meeting minutes.         Process email,  which includes responding on the Executive(s) behalf where appropriate and offering insight or additional context when necessary.  May include reading all incoming email and determining priority of action on behalf of the Executive.  Drafts responses where appropriate to expediate and facilitate a timely response on behalf of Executive.         Handle multiple demands and ad hoc issues efficiently while adjusting priorities and expectations that may arise outside of core business hours.         Liaise with other departments to obtain any needed signatures or approvals from the C-level executive(s) for required documentation and contracts by preparing those items for review and ensuring they flow through the office in a timely manner.         Organising the office layout and maintaining supplies of stationery and equipment.  Maintaining the condition of the office and arranging for necessary repairs.  Arranging regular testing for electrical equipment and safety devices        Co-ordinating schedules,  appointments and bookings for the office(s) if applicable.  Welcoming customers into the office.  Arranging and coordinating meetings in their location,  including preparing all necessary documents,  booking meeting rooms and organising catering        Maintains supply room and inventory.  Maintains delivery services at the local campus.  Maintains equipment and service contract files and negotiates with vendors for best service and price.         Prepares and maintains an operating budget for office services and monitors performance with budget.  Approves all invoices.             Knowledge,  Skills and Experience:          5 to 10 Years of relevant work experience is required.         Required Education: Associate Degree        Able to execute instructions and to request clarification when needed.         Able to use common office equipment.         Possesses strong data entry skills.         Able to recognize and attend to important details with accuracy and efficiency.         Able to demonstrate complex problem solving,  critical thinking,  and decision-making.         Able to interact effectively with higher levels of management (managers & above)        Understand,  communicate,  and collaborate effectively with people across various identities.         Able to converse and write effectively in English and other local / regional language.         Able to create and conduct formal presentations.         Able to negotiate skillfully and promote/sell ideas persuasively.         Possesses strong leadership skills with a willingness to lead,  create new ideas,  and be assertive.         Possesses strong organizational and time management skills,  driving tasks to completion.         Able to adjust readily to change and adapt as needed.         Able to constructively work under stress and pressure when faced with high workloads and deadlines.         Able to maintain and promote social,  ethical,  and organizational standards in conducting internal and external business activities.         Able to work independently with minimum supervision.         Able to effectively multi-task.         Able to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.         Able to collaborate and build solid,  effective working relationships with others.         Able to exhibit ability to be sensitive to the needs,  concerns,  and feelings of others.               Working Conditions:          Professional,  office environment.         Occasional non-standard work hours or overtime as business requires.         On-call availability required as necessary.         Local (in-country) travel required.                   What s In It For You?          Elective Benefits:   Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.       Grow Your Career:   Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development,  and many more on-demand courses.       Elevate Your Personal Well-Being:   Boost your financial,  physical,  and mental well-being through seminars,  events,  and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.       Diversity,  Equity & Inclusion:   It s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed.  Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education,  meaningful peer-to-peer conversations,  and equitable growth and development opportunities.       Make the Most of our Global Organization  : Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.       Connect with Your Community:   Participate in internal,  peer-led inclusive communities and activities,  including business resource groups,  local volunteering events,  and more environmental and social initiatives.             Don t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.        At Tech Data,  a TD SYNNEX Company,  we re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity,  equity and inclusion.  If you re excited about working for our company and believe you re a good fit for this role,  we encourage you to apply.  You may be exactly the person we re looking for!          We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to building a team that represents and empowers a variety of backgrounds,  perspectives,  and skills.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,  color,  religion,  national origin,  gender,  gender identity or expression,  sexual orientation,  protected veteran status,  disability,  genetics,  age,  or any other characteristic protected by law.

column1: Back Office / Front Office - Graphic Era Institute Of Medical Sciences
column2: Job Summary:  We are seeking a dynamic and presentable Front Office Executive to join the team at Graphic Era Institute of Medical Sciences Hospital. As the first point of contact for patients, visitors, and staff, the Front Office Executive will play a pivotal role in providing exceptional customer service and administrative support. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, professionalism, and the ability to handle various tasks efficiently in a hospital environment. Responsibilities: Patient Reception:  Welcome patients and visitors to the hospital courteously and assist them with inquiries, appointments, and directions to various departments or facilities. Appointment Management:  Schedule patient appointments, consultations, and follow-up visits accurately using the hospital's scheduling system. Coordinate with medical staff to ensure timely and efficient scheduling. Telephone Handling:  Answer incoming calls promptly and professionally. Direct calls to the appropriate department or individual and take messages as necessary. Provide information about hospital services, procedures, and policies over the phone. Patient Registration:  Register new patients, collect demographic and insurance information, and enter data accurately into the hospital's electronic medical records system. Verify insurance coverage and eligibility as needed. Check-in and Check-out:  Assist patients with the check-in process, including completing registration forms, obtaining consent, and collecting payments or co-payments. Coordinate patient discharge procedures, including billing and scheduling follow-up appointments. Visitor Assistance:  Provide assistance and information to visitors, including family members of patients, regarding visiting hours, hospital amenities, and nearby accommodations. Administrative Support:  Perform various administrative tasks, such as filing, photocopying, scanning, and faxing documents. Maintain and update patient records, forms, and other administrative documents. Supply Management:  Monitor inventory levels of office supplies and ensure adequate stock is maintained. Place orders for office supplies and equipment as needed, following hospital procurement procedures. Safety and Security:  Ensure compliance with hospital security protocols and procedures. Monitor visitor access and issue visitor badges as required. Respond appropriately to security and safety incidents or emergencies. Adherence to Policies:  Adhere to hospital policies, procedures, and regulations, including patient confidentiality and privacy laws. Maintain a clean and organized front desk area at all times. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field preferred. Previous experience as a Front Office Executive, Receptionist, or Customer Service Representative in a healthcare setting is advantageous. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with fluency in English and Hindi. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact professionally with patients, visitors, and staff from diverse backgrounds. Proficiency in computer applications, including Microsoft Office Suite and electronic medical records systems. Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Presentable appearance, professional demeanor, and customer service-oriented attitude. Knowledge of medical terminology and healthcare processes is desirable but not required. Flexibility to work shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as per the hospital's operational requirements. Commitment to upholding ethical standards, patient confidentiality, and quality service delivery.
column11: Back Office, Billing, Hospitality, OPD, Front Desk, Front Office, Hotel Management, Hospital Administration, Front Office Management, Hospital Management, health, Reception, Guest Handling, Guest Relations, Patient Care, Front Office Operations, ipd, Guest Relationship Management

Maintaining Cleanliness:    They might help maintain the cleanliness and tidiness of the office by organizing workspaces, cleaning common areas, and ensuring that supplies are stocked.        Assisting with Basic Administrative Tasks:    Office boys may assist with photocopying, scanning, and printing documents. They might also help with filing and organizing paperwork.        Preparing Refreshments:    In some cases, office boys might be responsible for preparing beverages like tea, coffee, or water for office staff and visitors.        Assisting Staff:    They might help employees with minor tasks such as setting up meeting rooms, arranging furniture, and helping with small IT-related issues.        Managing Office Supplies:    Office boys could keep track of office supplies such as stationery, paper, and other essentials, and ensure that there are no shortages.        Handling Incoming and Outgoing Mail:    They might help sort and distribute incoming mail and packages and prepare outgoing mail for dispatch.        Assisting in Events:    During office events, office boys might assist in setting up event spaces, arranging seating, and providing support as needed.
column11: Printing, Administration, Basic, Packaging, Outsourcing, Office management, Management, Office Staff, Recruitment

column2: **Position Title: Office and Warehouse Assistant** **Role Overview:** The Office and Warehouse Assistant plays a crucial role in maintaining the efficiency and functionality of both the office space and the warehouse environment. This multifaceted position requires a dynamic individual who can seamlessly transition between administrative tasks in the office and operational responsibilities in the warehouse. The primary goal is to support smooth operations by ensuring that both the office and warehouse are organized, well-maintained, and stocked with necessary supplies. **Key Responsibilities:** **Office Responsibilities:** 1. **Administrative Support:** Provide administrative support to owners, including but not limited to answering phones, responding to emails, and handling correspondence. 2. **Maintaining Office Supplies:** Monitor and replenish office supplies, such as stationery, kitchen supplies, and other consumables, ensuring that essential items are always available. 3. **Organizing Office Spaces:** Maintain cleanliness and organization in common areas, meeting rooms, and workspaces, including arranging furniture, managing storage, and ensuring a clutter-free environment. 4. **Assisting with Documentation:** Assist in the preparation, distribution, and filing of documents, reports, and presentations as required. 5. **Coordinating Meetings and Events:** Help in scheduling meetings, booking venues, coordinating catering services, and arranging necessary equipment for office events or meetings. **Warehouse Responsibilities:** 1. **Inventory Management:** Assist in maintaining accurate inventory records, including receiving, counting, and organizing incoming shipments, as well as conducting regular stock checks. 2. **Packing and Shipping:** Prepare orders for shipment, ensuring that items are properly packed, labeled, and documented according to shipping requirements. 3. **Warehouse Organization:** Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and hazard-free by arranging stock logically, maintaining aisle clearances, and following safety protocols. 4. **Assisting with Order Fulfillment:** Collaborate with warehouse staff to fulfill customer orders efficiently and accurately, including picking, packing, and staging items for shipment. 5. **Equipment Maintenance:** Assist in the maintenance and upkeep of warehouse equipment, by performing routine inspections and reporting any issues to the appropriate personnel. **Qualifications and Skills:** - Bachelors' degree or equivalent; additional certification in office administration or warehouse management is a plus. - Prior experience in a similar role, preferably in an office and warehouse environment. - Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively. - Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written, along with proficiency in using office software and basic warehouse management systems. - Preference will be given to applicants with experience in the hospitality supply vertical. Candidates displaying god experience in the textiles, apparel and gift segments will also be considered. - Physical stamina and the ability to lift heavy objects, stand for extended periods, and work in a fast-paced environment. - A proactive and adaptable attitude, with a willingness to take on new challenges and support colleagues as needed. **Reporting Structure:** The Office and Warehouse Assistant typically reports to the Office Manager or Operations Manager, depending on the organizational structure. They work closely with office staff, warehouse personnel, and external vendors to fulfill their duties effectively. **Preferred Candidate Profile: Office and Warehouse Assistant (Noida, India)** **Personal Attributes:** - Female candidate preferred. - Excellent English language skills, both verbal and written, to effectively communicate with internal teams and external stakeholders. - Presentable appearance and well-groomed demeanor, maintaining a professional image at all times. **Education and Experience:** - Bachelor's degree or equivalent qualification preferred. - Prior experience in office administration and warehouse management roles is advantageous. - Proficiency in using office software such as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other computer applications necessary for the role. **Skills and Abilities:** - Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment. - Attention to detail and accuracy in performing administrative and warehouse duties. - Adaptability and willingness to learn new processes and systems as required. - Physical fitness and stamina to handle warehouse tasks, including lifting and moving heavy objects. - Problem-solving skills to address issues that may arise in office and warehouse operations. **Additional Requirements:** - Familiarity with local regulations and procedures related to office and warehouse operations in Noida, India, is desirable. - Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team when required. - Proactive attitude towards ensuring the cleanliness, organization, and safety of both the office and warehouse spaces. - Availability to work flexible hours if needed to accommodate business needs. **Note:** This candidate profile aims to identify a well-rounded individual who can effectively fulfill the responsibilities of the Office and Warehouse Assistant position in Noida, India. While specific experience and qualifications are desirable, candidates who demonstrate the required skills, attributes, and a willingness to learn will also be considered.   Balancing Remote Work and In-Person Responsibilities:  For our Office and Warehouse Assistant role, this means having the flexibility to work from home for administrative tasks and office-related responsibilities, such as documentation, correspondence, and meeting coordination. However, there may be times when physical presence in the office or warehouse is required, such as inventory management, packing and shipping orders, or participating in team meetings and events. Conclusion:  By embracing a hybrid work environment, we can leverage the best of both worlds - the flexibility of remote work and the collaborative energy of in-person interactions.
